1.2
	28th Jun 2024
	1. Colour name required wherever colour hex code specified for the following categories - BPC, Fashion, Electronics, H&K;
	7th Apr 2024
	1. Removed "Backward Compatibility" section;
	7th Dec 2023
	1. Removed seller-on-record signing requirement;
	18th Nov 2023
	1. Added support for buyer NP integration with logistics;
2. Cancellation:
   1. Added support for force cancellation;
   2. Linking cancellation with IGM issue, with pre-cancel state;
3. Return:
   1. Linking return with IGM issue;
4. Others:
   1. Added support for payment collection by seller NP;
   2. Added support for communication of fulfillment delay (pickup, delivery);
   3. Added doc for authorization (OTP) flow;
	12th Nov 2023
	1. Updated categories for grocery;
2. Updated category, attributes for BPC;
3. Updated category, attributes for Home & Kitchen;
4. Updated category, attributes for Health & Wellness;
	4th Nov 2023
	1. Added (optional) price for default selections for F&B;
2. Added tracking attributes in /on_status to optimize track calls for hyperlocal / hub-based tracking;
	2nd Nov 2023
	1. Updated backward compatibility requirements, for pre-order & post-order flows, so that correct version is used;
	17th Oct 2023
	1. Added polygon serviceability using GeoJSON (polygon example, multi-polygon example);
	15th Oct 2023
	1. Updated offer construct - template definition, applicability rules and offer in quote;
2. Added quote type for fulfillment level tax, offer;
	7th Oct 2023
	1. Updated /confirm & /on_confirm flow rules to address dangling orders due to inappropriate use of error code 30018;
2. Additions to /on_track to support non-hyperlocal orders (in addition to tracking of hyperlocal orders already enabled); 
	29th Sep 2023
	1. Updated category, attributes for fashion;
2. Updated category, attributes for electronics;
	21st Sep 2023
	1. Added publishing static terms for transaction level contract in /search;
2. Added backward compatibility requirements;
3. Changed definition for item.tags.custom_group to refer to custom groups directly linked to base item (F&B). This fix is required to support 2 possible types of UX for customizations - single page, multi-page;
4. Added identifier for ISN/MSN to catalog.bpp/descriptor.type, /on_confirm;
5. Added scenario for seller NP to communicate acceptable finder fee;
	7th Sep 2023
	1. Added store reopening;
	20th Aug 2023
	1. Fix for customizable items (F&B) to include the full structure of the item (i.e. base item and customizations) in order.items[];
This fix is required because:
i. dynamic item created by buyer NP is actually a grouping of base item & customizations, identified by item.parent_item_id and using this value in item.id would create inconsistencies in the implementation;
ii. Since all keys in order.items[] (except fulfillment_id) is only updated by buyer NP, the buyer NP needs this to identify the components of the customizable items for processing callbacks for order & post-order flows (explained below);
iii. All buyer NPs have validations in place where they match the item ids in order.items[] with the corresponding item ids in order.quote.breakup[];
Following APIs are updated - /on_select, /init, /on_init, /confirm, /on_confirm, /on_update, /on_status;
	19th July 2023
	1. Incremental refresh - entire item record to be sent for any delta change for item(s);
2. Changed /track & /on_track - removed callback_url, updates will be through polling only;
3. Updated swagger link;
	15th July 2023
	1. Moved meta for variants to provider categories (same level as customization groups, custom menus);
	2nd July 2023
	1. Changed structure of customization groups, dynamic items in all APIs;
	19th June 2023
	1. Changes include:
   1. examples of catalog for different electronics sub-categories;
   2. templatized offer definitions with required rules;
   3. changed definition of delivery / pickup timings to be consistent with online order timings;
   4. added provider location to /on_select;
	12th June 2023
	1. Changes include:
   1. changed GST no of ISN to GST no for seller NP in /on_init, added GST no for buyer NP in /confirm;
   2. changed refresh_window in incremental catalog refresh (/search) to start_time, end_time;
   3. added item availability to F&B catalog;
	6th June 2023
	1. Added features as per the feature doc (changes from v1.1 highlighted)
	________________


1. Introduction
ONDC API contracts map business requirements for various use case scenarios to a set of attribute keys in different APIs and ensures interoperability, between a buyer NP & seller NP, as follows:
* by defining the set of attribute keys that need to be exchanged to establish a handshake between the buyer NP & seller NP;
* clearly defining the single source of truth for each attribute key and thereby establishing mutability & immutability of these keys on behalf of the participants at each end of the transaction;
This API contract document is structured as follows:
* JSON payload for each API request & response;
* Definition & enumerations of specific attribute keys, as applicable;
* Examples of usage of specific attribute keys for a business requirement, as applicable;
* Expected behaviour of APIs on the network;
Retail API contract includes the following APIs:
1. Pre-order APIs
   * /search - buyer NP specifies the search intent for live search or for catalog crawl;
   * /on_search - seller NP responds with the catalog based on the search intent;
   * /select - buyer NP specifies the items & quantity selected by the buyer;
   * /on_select - seller NP responds with the serviceability info, quote & O2D TAT for selected items;
   * /init & /on_init - buyer & seller NP specify & agree to the terms & conditions prior to placing the order;
   * /confirm - buyer NP places the order on behalf of the buyer;
   * /on_confirm - seller NP responds to the order placed either through auto-acceptance or deferred acceptance or rejection of the order;
2. Post-order APIs
   * /status - buyer NP requests for the current status of the order;
   * /on_status - seller NP provides the current status of the order;
   * /cancel - buyer NP places cancellation request for the order;
   * /on_cancel - seller NP responds to the buyer NP cancellation request or cancels the order directly;
   * /update - buyer NP initiates a part return or cancel request (for specific items) on behalf of the buyer;
   * /on_update - seller NP responds to the buyer NP part return / cancel request or initiates a part cancel request (for specific items) directly;
   * /track - buyer NP requests for live tracking of order;
   * /on_track - seller NP responds with live tracking details for order;
All attribute keys, defined in this API contract, are mandatory, unless explicitly mentioned otherwise. Participants may validate the request & response payloads, based on mandatory attribute keys, as defined in this contract and respond with "NACK" (along with appropriate error code as defined here) for invalid payloads. Any payload, without optional attribute keys, cannot be considered as invalid.
This API contract has been defined after incorporating requirements (as defined in the feature doc shared earlier).
All participants are required to ensure full compliance with this API contract on the live ONDC network.
________________
2. Signing & Verification of requests & responses
1. Key pairs, for signing & encryption, can be generated using any standard library e.g. libsodium, Bouncy Castle, etc.
2. Creating key pairs
* Create key pairs, for signing (ed25519) & encryption (X25519);
* Update base64 encoded public keys in registry;
* Utility to generate signing key pairs and test signing & verification is here;
3. Auth Header Signing
* Generate UTF-8 byte array from json payload;
* Generate Blake2b hash from UTF-8 byte array;
* Create base64 encoding of Blake2b hash, this becomes the digest for signing;
* Sign the request, using your private signing key, and add the signature to the request authorization header, following steps documented here;
4. Auth Header Verification
* Extract the digest from the encoded signature in the request;
* Get the signing_public_key from registry using lookup (by using the ukId in the authorization header);
* Create (UTF-8) byte array from the raw payload and generate Blake2b hash;
* Compare generated Blake2b hash with the decoded digest from the signature in the request;
* In case of failure to verify, HTTP error 401 should be thrown;
________________
   3. Registry lookup
   1. There are 3 possible participant types, for each domain, in the ONDC registry:
   * Buyer NP
   * Seller NP (ISN - inventory seller node)
   * Seller NP (MSN - marketplace seller node or aggregator)
   2. Each participant type, defined above, will have an entry in the registry for their entity;
   3. Every participant on the ONDC registry will have one or more entries in the registry, with unique identifier ("ukid") for each such entry;
   4. Signing & Verification of requests and responses using auth headers is defined here;
   5. All requests & responses have to be signed by the sender and verified by the receiver. If any request fails verification, it should be rejected (NACK’d) with http 401 error code;
   6. The identity of the sender of a request is sent, through the auth header, as follows:
keyId="{subscriber_id}|{unique_key_id}|{algorithm}"
   7. Signing by all participants will be using their private key, for which the corresponding public key will be in the registry for their "ukid";
   8. Verification of requests is using registry lookup using this API spec. Participants can either use the registry lookup endpoints from here or cache the registry locally (with refresh at regular interval) for a local lookup;
   9. Following options are available:
   * /lookup
request:
    {
        "subscriber_id":"buyerNP.com",
        "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
        "ukId":"UKID1",
        "country[1]":"IND",
        "city[2]":"std:080",
        "type[3]":"BPP"
    }
response:
(will be an array with 1 or more objects, depending on whether the entity, identified by the subscriber_id, has registered as different participants in a domain, e.g. buyer NP, seller NP)
[
    {
        "subscriber_id":"buyerNP.com",
        "status":"SUBSCRIBED",
        "ukId":"UKID1",
        "subscriber_url":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
        "country":"IND",
        "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
        "valid_from":"2023-06-03T06:00:00.000Z",
        "valid_until":"2027-06-02T06:00:00.000Z",
        "type":"BPP",
        "signing_public_key": "<ed25519_signing_public_key>",
        "encr_public_key": "<x25519_encryption_public_key>",
        "created":"2023-06-03T06:00:00.000Z",
        "updated":"2023-06-03T06:00:00.000Z",
        "br_id":"<br_id>",
        "city":"std:080"
    }
]
   * /vlookup
{
  "sender_subscriber_id[4]":"buyerNP.com",
  "request_id[5]":"123456789",
  "timestamp[6]":"2023-06-03T06:00:00.000Z",
  "search_parameters":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "subscriber_id[7]":"sellerNP.com",
    "country":"IND",
    "type":"sellerApp[8]",
    "city[9]":"std:080"
  },
  "signature[10]":""
}
________________
   4. Construct of APIs & transaction trail
   1. All APIs follow the same construct and include:
   * Context - includes transaction_id, message_id and other attribute keys that identify the source & destination of the message being sent through the API request or response;
   * Message - identifies the content of the message e.g. the search intent, catalog details, order details, etc.;
   2. All APIs are asynchronous, i.e.:
   * request is sent from sender to recipient;
   * recipient acknowledges the request by sending an "ACK" (or "NACK" if they cannot validate the request);
   * recipient sends response through the callback for the corresponding request API e.g. /on_search callback for /search request;
   * recipient of callback (could be the original sender) acknowledges the response by sending an "ACK" (or "NACK" if they cannot validate the request);
   3. Every request & response pair is identified by a transaction_id + unique message_id & the sender of a request is able to correlate the response to the request using the above;
   4. If a stale request or response is received, i.e. with timestamp earlier than similar request or response (identified by the transaction_id + message_id) that has already been processed, the recipient can send "NACK" with the error code "20002" (buyer NP) and "30022" (seller NP);
   5. Error block can be sent in sync (in response to request) or async (along with callback) mode and should have the following attribute keys: error.type, error.code;
   6. ONDC standard error codes are defined here;
   7. Transaction trail for a buyer is maintained through a unique transaction_id for the pre-order stage, i.e. /search, /select, /init, /confirm. However, considering that most buyer apps cache catalogs that are reused by multiple buyer apps, for providing a good buyer experience, an unique transaction_id is maintained for /select, /init & /confirm.
   8. Buyer apps with live search functionality can use the same transaction_id across the entire pre-order stage;
   9. Unique id for an order on a network will be identified by the transaction_id & order id;
   10. Swagger link is here;
________________


   5. API Contract
/search
   * Search API will be used to communicate the intent for a full or incremental catalog refresh;
   * Search request is always broadcast through the gateway so that all NPs who have registered for the specific domain, in the search request, are notified;
   * Buyer NP (BNP) will also publish the static terms for transaction level contract through this API;
Full catalog refresh
   * Includes following enhancements:
   * Full catalog response will be sent directly by the seller NPs to the buyer NP from which the search request was received through the gateway;
   * Option for distributed search by city by category:
   * Buyer NPs can optionally refresh catalogs for a city by sub-category, e.g. for Grocery (ONDC:RET10), catalog can be refreshed separately for each sub-category;
   * However, this will not be possible for categories, such as F&B, where the category hierarchy is not consistent across merchants;
   * Buyer NP can decide to refresh catalog as follows:
   * by city by sub-category for Grocery, i.e. Context.domain="ONDC:RET10", category.id = "Foodgrains";
   * only by city for F&B, i.e. Context.domain = "ONDC:RET11";
   * Distributed search i.e. by category will also allow differential buyer finder fee for different sub-categories in a domain;
   * Option for buyer NP to specify whether search response should be in the form of inline response in /on_search (as of now) or as an authorized link (with limited time validity) for the buyer NP to download & ingest;
________________
i. Search by city[11]
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10[12]",
    "action":"search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080[13]",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id[14]":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri[15]":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M1",
    "timestamp[16]":"2023-06-03T08:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl[17]":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "intent":
    {
      "category[18]":
      {
        "id":"Foodgrains[19]"
      },
      "fulfillment[20]":
      {
        "type":"Delivery"
      },
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_type":"percent[a][b][21]",
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_amount[22]":"3"
      },
      "tags":
      [
        {
          "code":"bap_terms[23]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"static_terms",
              "value":""
            },
            {
              "code":"static_terms_new",
              "value":"https://github.com/ONDC-Official/NP-Static-Terms/buyerNP_BNP/1.0/tc.pdf"
            },[c]
            {
              "code":"effective_date",
              "value":"2023-10-01T00:00:00.000Z"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

          ]

      ]
    }
  }
}

  },

    "intent":

      {
        "descriptor":
        {
          "name":"coffee"
        }
      },
      "fulfillment":
      {

        "end":
        {
          "location":
          {
            "gps[28]":"12.974002,77.613458",
            "address"[29]:
            {
              "area_code":"560001"
            }
          }
        }
      },
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_type":"percent",
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_amount":"3"
      },
      "tags":
      [
        {

              "value":""
            },
            {

            },
            {
              "code":"effective_date",
              "value":"2023-10-01T00:00:00.000Z"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

________________


Incremental catalog refresh
      * Incremental refresh is necessary for buyer NPs that cache catalogs and reflect changes since the last full catalog refresh;
      * Every buyer NP that wants to consume incremental catalog changes should send a /search request through the gateway. This will be as an enhancement to the current /search API (for city) in the API contract;
      * Buyer NP can send following config params in the /search request:
      * Full refresh:
      * payload_type - inline (response contains catalog), link (response points to link for accessing catalog[f][g][h]);
      * Incremental refresh:
      * mode - "start", "stop";
      * start_time - start time for incremental refresh;
      * end_time - end time for incremental refresh;
      * Following scenarios are possible:
      * Buyer NP requests 1-time incremental refresh:
      * start_time < Context.timestamp, end_time < Context.timestamp, end_time > start_time (means buyer NP pulls incremental updates from start_time to end_time in a single solicited response);
      * Buyer NP requests regular incremental refresh until stopped:
      * mode="start", start_time <= Context.timestamp (means seller NP pushes incremental updates from start_time at a frequency within a range of 1-30 mins). If no start_time provided, it defaults to Context.timestamp;
      * Seller NP should aggregate and push updates, at the same time, to all buyer NPs that have requested for incremental refresh;
      * If there are no incremental catalog updates, seller NP should not send empty catalog;[i][j]
      * Buyer NP requests stopping of incremental refresh:
      * mode="stop";
      * All the above scenarios are mandatory for all NPs;
      * Buyer NPs can use the /search API to request for solicited or unsolicited incremental catalog refresh:
      * for solicited response, the response will have the same transaction_id & message_id as the request;
      * for unsolicited response, the response will have the same transaction_id but different message_id;
      * At any point of time, buyer NP may have only 1 open incremental search request (i.e. 1-time or regular). Accordingly, buyer NP needs to stop the current incremental search request before initiating a new incremental search request:
      * transaction_id for stop incremental search request should be same as start incremental search request;[k][l]
      * To handle race condition where the buyer NP receives full & incremental refresh at the same time, versioning will be enabled for both types of refresh:
      * Full refresh will have a timestamp at the provider & location level and indicates when the snapshot was generated;
      * Incremental refresh will have a timestamp at provider / location / item level and indicates the time of the event;
      * In case of race condition where the buyer NP receives full & incremental refresh at the same time, either of these approaches is feasible:
      * Buyer NP can process the full refresh and then initiate incremental refresh e.g. if full refresh at 8AM was ingested between 8-9AM, buyer NP can stop the incremental refresh before initiating the full refresh or choose to ignore all incremental refresh within this duration of catalog ingestion. After processing the full refresh, buyer NP can initiate incremental refresh based on the timestamp in full refresh;
      * Buyer NPs can process full & incremental refresh in sequence and use the timestamp to decide which incremental refresh updates to persist;
      * To handle error conditions, i.e. buyer NP not responding or responding with a NACK, the seller NP should push catalog updates in multiple incremental refresh until ACK is received from all buyer NPs. Response format for NACK is here;
________________
Request incremental catalog refresh (pull)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M1",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T09:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "intent":
    {
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_type":"percent",
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_amount":"3"
      }[m][n][o][p][q][r][s],
      "tags":
      [
        {
          "code":"catalog_inc[36]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"start_time",
              "value":"2023-06-03T08:00:00.000Z"
            },
            {
              "code":"end_time",
              "value":"2023-06-03T09:00:00.000Z[37]"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"bap_terms[38]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"static_terms",
              "value":""
            },
            {
              "code":"static_terms_new",
              "value":"https://github.com/ONDC-Official/NP-Static-Terms/buyerNP_BNP/1.0/tc.pdf"
            },
            {
              "code":"effective_date",
              "value":"2023-10-01T00:00:00.000Z"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
         1. In this case, incremental updates will be sent from 8AM to 9AM in a single solicited response[t];
________________
Request for incremental catalog refresh (push)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*"[u][v],
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M1",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "intent":
    {
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_type":"percent",
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_amount":"3"
      },
      "tags":
      [
        {
          "code":"catalog_inc",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"mode",
              "value":"start"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"bap_terms[39]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"static_terms",
              "value":""
            },
            {
              "code":"static_terms_new",
              "value":"https://github.com/ONDC-Official/NP-Static-Terms/buyerNP_BNP/1.0/tc.pdf"
            },
            {
              "code":"effective_date",
              "value":"2023-10-01T00:00:00.000Z"[w][x]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
         1. In this case, incremental changes will be pushed from Context.timestamp and aggregated within a range of 1-30 mins at the seller NP discretion;[y][z]
________________
Stop incremental refresh (push)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M1",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "intent":
    {
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_type":"percent",
        "@ondc/org/buyer_app_finder_fee_amount":"3"
      },
      "tags":
      [
        {
          "code":"catalog_inc",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"mode",
              "value":"stop"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
________________
/on_search
Full catalog refresh
            * Full catalog refresh includes the complete catalog, per provider, for a seller NP at a point in time (as identified by Context.timestamp). If a buyer NP is caching the catalog, the list of items for a provider will be overwritten with the list of items in the catalog refresh, i.e. existing items in the buyer NP cache which aren’t in the catalog refresh will be disabled;
            * However, since seller NPs may send separate catalog responses per provider (i.e. pagination by provider[aa][ab]), it is possible that a catalog response for a provider may not be received by the buyer NP. Hence, provider(s) must be explicitly disabled, through the incremental refresh, and cannot be disabled if a response isn’t received in the catalog response;[ac][ad]
            * Following enhancements are included:
            * Customizations & Variants[ae][af]
            * Customizations may be used to create make-to-order products (e.g. F&B), by defining the base product and the mandatory & optional customizations for the product;
            * Customizations will be enabled using customization groups and individual customizations. Individual customizations are similar to SKU items (with price, inventory, veg/non-veg attributes);
            * Customizations can also be used to send special instructions e.g. for:
            * Food preparation ("less spicy", "less salt", etc.);
            * Packaging related instructions (card for "Happy Birthday", etc.);
            * Variants may be used by buyer NPs to group multiple items for display;
            * Even though the examples here show customizations & variants for specific categories, it can be used for other categories such as electronics, fashion, grocery, pharma, home & kitchen, etc.;
            * Custom Menu
            * Custom Menu may be used to define a provider-level menu for rendering on the buyer app. Even though the examples below show custom menus for F&B, it can be used for other categories such as electronics, fashion, grocery, etc.;
            * Custom menu structure is hierarchical and can include multiple levels;
            * Custom menu will have display sequence at each of the levels;
            * Item can be assigned to multiple menu items with ranking for display within the custom menu;
            * The menu items will have an unique display sequence, for parent & child menu items;
            * Separate UOM & quantity for item
            * Offers[ag][ah]
            * Offers can be defined for a provider, either in the full or incremental catalog refresh;
            * An offer can be for:
            * retail
            * logistics
            * An offer can be:
            * opt-in
            * auto-applied
            * An offer will include the following info:
            * offer id
            * offer type
            * images - may be used as banners to promote the offer from a merchant;
            * An offer applicability criteria can include one or more of the following:
            * location(s);
            * categories;
            * item(s);
            * time period validity;
            * Offer definitions will be templatized and the buyer NP can create the appropriate description for the offers from the template variables (qualifier, benefit[ai][aj]) and using the applicable criteria for location(s), categories, item(s), time period validity;
            * Definition template


	Qualifier
	Benefit
	#
	Offer type
	Offer id (example)
	Min value
	Item count
	Item ID
	Value
	Value type
	Value cap
	Item count
	Item id
	Item value
	1
	discount
	DISCP60
	₹159
	

	

	-60
	percent
	-₹120
	

	

	

	2
	discount
	FLAT150
	₹499
	

	

	-₹150
	amount
	

	

	

	

	3
	buyXgetY
	BUY2GET3
	

	2
	

	

	

	

	3
	item id
	

	4
	freebie
	FREEBIE
	₹598
	

	

	

	

	

	1
	item id
	₹200
	In the template above:
            * Offer type - standard offer types:
            * discount - discount percent or amount applied to the cart value, with or without a cap, and may be based on minimum cart value;
            * buyXgetY - for every "X" item count in the cart, total of "Y" items will be offered (i.e. "Y" - "X" additional items), at 0 additional value;
            * freebie - for a minimum order value, 1 or more free item(s) will be offered at 0 value;
            * Offer id[ak][al] - unique offer id from provider;
            * Offer qualifiers:
            * Min value - min cart value for the offer to be applicable;
            * Item count - min count of items in the cart for the offer to be applicable;
            * Item id - Item id that qualifies for offer;
            * Offer benefit:
            * Value - discount on the cart value (-ve) or value for extra items offered (0);
            * Value type - "percent", "amount";
            * Value cap - cap on the offer value;
            * Item count - total count of items offered;
            * Item id - additional item offered, should be part of the catalog;
            * Item value - actual value of item being offered;
Description of the above (example) offer ids:
            * DISCP60 - 60% off up to ₹120, for order value above ₹159;
            * DISCA150[am][an] - flat 150 off, for order value above ₹499;
            * BUY2GET3 - buy 2 items, get additional item for free or for offered price;
            * FREEBIE - free item (of value ₹200) for order value above ₹598;
            * Provider level enhancements
            * Enabling store (i.e. location) which may have been disabled in incremental catalog refresh;
            * Provider level fulfillment options e.g. for delivery, self-pickup and the corresponding timings (for hyperlocal categories only);
            * Minimum order value;
            * Option for provider catalog zip file in lieu of embedding the json inline in the /on_search response;
            * Provider level credentials, such as certifications, awards, export/import licences etc;
            * Enhanced store timings;
________________
Catalog (F&B)
F&B catalog includes the following:
            * Base (SKU) items with item id e.g. "Farmhouse Pizza";
            * 1 or more customization groups defined for the provider, along with configurations (id, name, min / max, input type, sequence for display), e.g. "Crust", "Size";
            * 1 or more variant grouping(s) defined for the provider;
            * 1 or more customizations - each customization is similar to base item and each customization may be assigned to 1 or more customization group, e.g. "Small", "Medium", "Large" may be customizations assigned to customization group "Size";
            * Customizations for the base item as follows:
            * Base (SKU) item may be customized using 1 or more customization groups;
            * If any of the mandatory customizations aren’t defined (i.e. definition for customization group with min > 0 is not found or invalid or no customizations mapped to this customization group), the buyer NP may consider the base item as invalid & disable accordingly;
            * Configurations (min / max, sequence for display) may be overridden at item level. If not overridden, configurations will be inherited from the customization group definition;
            * Contract payload is below and includes every construct both required & optional for F&B. Detailed examples, for specific use-cases are below;
{

}
N.B.
            1. /on_search responses may be paginated by provider, i.e. separate /on_search response per provider with the same transaction_id and message_id as /search;
            2. Serviceability construct has to be explicitly defined as specified here. Both old construct (radius at provider location) and new construct (by category using radius / pincode / pan-India) will need to be supported until the old construct is deprecated;
            3. Enabling & disabling of providers and out-of-stock items have to be explicitly defined as specified here;
________________

N.B.
            1. Above payload for grocery shows 3 different varieties of Atta grouped together using a variant definition. Buyer NP may choose to render either by grouping as variant or as individual SKUs;
            2. /on_search responses may be paginated by provider, i.e. separate /on_search response per provider with the same transaction_id and message_id as /search;[bz][ca]
            3. Serviceability construct has to be explicitly defined as specified here. Both old construct (radius at provider location) and new construct (by category using radius / pincode / pan-India) will need to be supported until the old construct is deprecated;
            4. Enabling & disabling of providers and out-of-stock items have to be explicitly defined as specified here;
________________

}
N.B.
            1. /on_search responses may be paginated by provider, i.e. separate /on_search response per provider with the same transaction_id and message_id as /search;
            2. Serviceability construct has to be explicitly defined as specified here. Both old construct (radius at provider location) and new construct (by category using radius / pincode / pan-India) will need to be supported until the old construct is deprecated;
            3. Enabling & disabling of providers and out-of-stock items have to be explicitly defined as specified here;
________________


Examples
1. F&B (Farmhouse Pizza)
Crust (any 1 option) *
	Size (any 1 option) *
	Toppings (up to 2 options)
	New Hand Tossed
(customization - C1, customization group - CG1, nested customization group - CG2)
	Regular
(customization - C3, customization group - CG2, nested customization group - CG4)
	Grilled Mushrooms (₹35);
(customization - C8, customization group - CG4)
Fresh Tomato (₹35);
(customization - C9, customization group - CG4)
Pepper Barbeque Chicken (₹50);
(customization - C10, customization group - CG4)
	Large (₹450)
(customization - C4, customization group - CG2, nested customization group - CG5)
	Grilled Mushrooms (₹80);
(customization - C11, customization group - CG5)
Fresh Tomato (₹80);
(customization - C12, customization group - CG5)
Pepper Barbeque Chicken (₹95);
(customization - C13, customization group - CG5)
	Medium (₹210)
(customization - C5, customization group - CG2, nested customization group - CG6)
	Grilled Mushrooms (₹60);
(customization - C14, customization group - CG6)
Fresh Tomato (₹60);
(customization - C15, customization group - CG6)
Pepper Barbeque Chicken (₹75);
(customization - C16, customization group - CG6)
	100% Wheat Thin Crust
(customization - C2, customization group - CG1, nested customization group - CG3)
	Regular (₹45)
(customization - C6, customization group - CG3, nested customization group - CG4)
	Grilled Mushrooms (₹35);
(customization - C8, customization group - CG4)
Fresh Tomato (₹35);
(customization - C9, customization group - CG4)
Pepper Barbeque Chicken (₹50);
(customization - C10, customization group - CG4)
	Medium (₹275)
(customization - C7, customization group - CG3, nested customization group - CG6)
	Grilled Mushrooms (₹60);
(customization - C14, customization group - CG6)
Fresh Tomato (₹60);
(customization - C15, customization group - CG6)
Pepper Barbeque Chicken (₹75);
(customization - C16, customization group - CG6)
	In this example:
            * Base price is ₹269 and all prices shown in the table above are incremental to the base price;
            * Mandatory customizations - crust, size;
            * Optional customizations - toppings;
            * 1 item (SKU) will be defined for the product and all customizations defined as related items (with inventory, price, veg/non-veg attributes) and customization groups;
            * Customization & Customization groups mapped above & defined in the payload below;
Payload

________________
2. F&B (Mexican Patty Sandwich)
Variant (1 option) *
	Choice of bread (1 option) *
	Choice of preparation
	Choose Add Ons (up to 1 option)
	Choose Veggies (up to 1 option)
	Choose Sauces (up to 1 option)
	Choose Offers (up to 1 option)
	Mexican Bean Patty 15cm [6 inches]
(customization - C1, customization group - CG1, nested customization groups - CG2, CG3, CG4, CG6, CG7, CG8)
	Multigrain Honey Oats;
(customization - C3, customization group - CG2)
Parmesan Oregano;
(customization - C4, customization group - CG2)
	Plain bread;
(customization - C5, customization group - CG3)
Toasted bread;
(customization - C6, customization croup - CG3)
	Extra Cheese Slice (₹30);
(customization - C7, customization group - CG4)
	Lettuce;
(customization - C9, customization group - CG6)
	Eggless Mayo;
(customization - C9, customization group - CG7)
	Dark Chunk Choc Cookies (₹99);
(customization - C10, customization group - CG8)
	Make Cheese Pull Mexican Patty 30cm (₹270)
(customization - C2, customization group - CG1, nested customization groups - CG2, CG5, CG7, CG8)
	N/A
	Extra Mexican Bean Patty Footlong (₹120)
(customization - C8, customization group - CG5)
	N/A
	In this example:
            * Base price is ₹229 and all prices shown in the table above are incremental to the base price;
            * Mandatory customizations - variant, choice of bread;
            * Optional customizations - choice of preparation, add ons, veggies, sauces, offers;
            * 1 item (SKU) will be defined for the product and all customizations defined as related items (with inventory, price, veg/non-veg attributes) and customization groups;
            * Customization & Customization groups mapped above & defined in the payload below;
Payload

________________
3. F&B - (Veg & Non-Veg Pizza Combo)
Choice of Crust (any 1 option)
	First Veg Half (any 1 option)
	Second Non-Veg Half (any 1 option)
	Pan Tossed;
(customization - C1, customization group - CG1, nested customization group - CG2, CG3)
Cheese Blast (₹99);
(customization - C2, customization group - CG1, nested customization group - CG2, CG3)
Chicken Cheese Blast (₹129);
(customization - C3, customization group - CG1, nested customization group - CG2, CG3)
	Double Cheese Margherita;
(customization - C4, customization group - CG2)
Paneer Tikka (₹50);
(customization - C5, customization group - CG2)
Farmer’s Market;
(customization - C6, customization group - CG2)
Spicy Mexicano (₹50);
(customization - C7, customization group - CG2)
	Chicken Smokey Joe;
(customization - C8, customization group - CG3)
Peri Peri Chicken (₹40);
(customization - C9, customization group - CG3)
BBQ Chicken (₹40);
(customization - C10, customization group - CG3)
	In this example:
            * Base price is ₹400 and all prices shown in the table above are incremental to the base price;
            * Mandatory customizations - choice of crust, first veg half, second non-veg half;
            * 1 item (SKU) will be defined for the product and all customizations defined as related items (with inventory, price, veg/non-veg attributes) linked to customization groups;
            * Customization & Customization groups mapped above & defined in the payload below;
Payload

________________


4. Fashion
Consider the following example:
This will be defined as 7 separate SKUs grouped together. Buyer NPs may choose to render as individual SKUs or as grouped;
Name
	Colour
	Size
	Price
	MRP
	Item ID
	Allen Solly Men T-shirt
	Coral
	S
	₹579
	₹999
	I1
	M
	₹538
	₹999

	L
	₹569
	₹999
	I3
	Green
	2XL
	₹948
	₹999
	I4
	Yellow
	L
	₹589
	₹999
	I5
	XL
	₹789
	₹999
	I6
	2XL
	₹689
	₹999
	I7

________________
5. BPC
Example below shows catalog for 1 item but variants can be created similar to examples above;
Payload
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET13",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"on_search",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M1",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/descriptor":
      {
        "name":"Seller NP",
        "symbol":"https://sellerNP.com/images/np.png",
        "short_desc":"Seller Marketplace",
        "long_desc":"Seller Marketplace",
        "images":
        [
          "https://sellerNP.com/images/np.png"
        ],
        "tags":
        [
          {
            "code":"bpp_terms",
            "list":
            [
              {
                "code":"np_type",
                "value":"MSN[471]"
              },
              {
                "code":"accept_bap_terms",
                "value":"Y"
              },
              {
                "code":"collect_payment[472]",
                "value":"Y[473]"
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
      },
      "bpp/providers":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "time":
          {
            "label":"enable",
            "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z[474]"
          },
          "fulfillments":
          [
            {
              "id":"F1",
              "type":"Delivery",
              "contact":
              {
                "phone":"9886098860",
                "email":"abc@xyz.com"
              }
            }
          ],
          "descriptor":
          {
            "name":"Store 1",
            "symbol":"https://sellerNP.com/images/store1.png",
            "short_desc":"Store 1",
            "long_desc":"Store 1",
            "images":
            [
              "https://sellerNP.com/images/store1.png"
            ]
          },
          "ttl":"P1D",
          "locations":

              "id":"L1",

              "circle[eo][ep]":

                "gps":"12.967555,77.749666",
                "radius":
                {
                  "unit":"km",
                  "value":"3"
                }
              }
            }
          ],
          "items":
          [
            {
              "id":"I1",
              "time":

                "label":"enable[477]",

________________
6. Electronics
Consider the following example:
This will be defined as 5 separate SKUs grouped together. Buyer NPs may choose to render as individual SKUs or as grouped;
Name
	Colour
	Size
	Price
	MRP
	Item ID
	Apple iPhone 14
	Starlight
	128GB
	₹67,999
	₹79,990
	I1
	512GB
	₹97,999
	₹109,990
	I2
	Midnight (black)
	128GB
	₹69,999
	₹79,990
	I3
	512GB
	₹97,999
	₹109,990
	I4 (with engraving option for ₹1000); customization group - CG1
	Payload
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET14",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"on_search",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M1",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/descriptor":
      {
        "name":"Seller NP",
        "symbol":"https://sellerNP.com/images/np.png",
        "short_desc":"Seller Marketplace",
        "long_desc":"Seller Marketplace",
        "images":
        [
          "https://sellerNP.com/images/np.png"
        ],
        "tags":
        [
          {
            "code":"bpp_terms",
            "list":
            [
              {
                "code":"np_type",
                "value":"MSN[485]"
              },
              {
                "code":"accept_bap_terms",
                "value":"Y"
              },
              {
                "code":"collect_payment[486]",
                "value":"Y[487]"
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
      },
      "bpp/providers":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "time":
          {
            "label":"enable",
            "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z[488]"
          },
          "fulfillments":
          [
            {
              "id":"F1",
              "type":"Delivery",
              "contact":
              {
                "phone":"9886098860",
                "email":"abc@xyz.com"
              }
            }
          ],
          "descriptor":
          {
            "name":"Store 1",
            "symbol":"https://sellerNP.com/images/store1.png",
            "short_desc":"Store 1",
            "long_desc":"Store 1",
            "images":
            [
              "https://sellerNP.com/images/store1.png"
            ]
          },
          "ttl":"P1D",
          "locations":
          [
            {
              "id":"L1",
              "time":
              {
                "label":"enable[489]",
                "timestamp":"2023-06-03T07:30:30.000Z[490]",
                "days":"1,2,3,4,5,6,7",
                "schedule":
                {
                  "holidays":
                  [
                    "2023-08-15"
                  ],
                  "frequency":"PT4H",
                  "times":
                  [[fd]
                    "1100",
                    "1900"
                  ]
                },
                "range":
                {
                  "start":"1100",
                  "end":"2100"
                }
              },
              "gps":"12.967555,77.749666",
              "address":
              {
                "locality":"Jayanagar",
                "street":"Jayanagar 4th Block",
                "city":"Bengaluru",
                "area_code":"560076",
                "state":"KA"
              },
              "circle":
              {
                "gps":"12.967555,77.749666",
                "radius":
                {
                  "unit":"km",
                  "value":"3"
                }
              }
            }
          ],
          "categories":
          [
            {
              "id":"CG1",
              "descriptor":
              {
                "name":"Engraving"
              },
              "tags":
              [
                {
                  "code":"type",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"type",
                      "value":"custom_group"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "code":"config",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"min",
                      "value":"1"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"max",
                      "value":"1"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"input",
                      "value":"text[491]"
                    },[fe][ff]
                    {
                      "code":"seq",
                      "value":"1"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "id":"V1",
              "descriptor":
              {
                "name":"Variant Group 1"
              },
              "tags":
              [
                {
                  "code":"type",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"type",
                      "value":"variant_group"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "code":"attr",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"name",
                      "value":"item.tags.attribute.colour"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"seq",
                      "value":"1"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "code":"attr",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"name",
                      "value":"item.tags.attribute.size"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"seq",
                      "value":"2"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ],
          "items":
          [
            {
              "id":"I1",
              "time":
              {
                "label":"enable[492]",
                "timestamp":"2023-06-03T07:30:00.000Z[493]"

              {
                "name":"Apple iPhone 14",
                "code":"3:GTIN#[495]",

                "long_desc":"Apple iPhone 14",
                "images":
                [
                  "https://sellerNP.com/images/i1.png"
                ]
              },
              "quantity":

                    "value":"1"
                  }
                },
                "available":
                {
                  "count":"99"
                },
                "maximum":
                {
                  "count":"99"
                }

              "@ondc/org/seller_pickup_return":true,
              "@ondc/org/time_to_ship":"PT3H",
              "@ondc/org/available_on_cod":false,
              "@ondc/org/contact_details_consumer_care": "Ramesh,ramesh@abc.com,18004254444",
              "@ondc/org/statutory_reqs_packaged_commodities":
              {
                "manufacturer_or_packer_name":"Foxconn Ltd",
                "manufacturer_or_packer_address":"A-1, Chennai-Bangalore National Highway, Nh-4, Sriperumbudur, Kanchipuram, Tamil Nadu 602105",

              },
              "tags":
              [
                {
                  "code":"origin",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"country",
                      "value":"IND"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "code":"attribute[497]",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"brand",
                      "value":"iPhone"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"model",
                      "value":"iPhone 14"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"model_year",
                      "value":"2021"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"colour",
                      "value":"#FAF7F2"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"colour_name[498]",
                      "value":"Starlight"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"ram",

________________
/on_search sync response (ACK, NACK)
In the sync response to /on_search, the buyer NP can provide the following information:
            * On successful ingestion of the response:
            * Deep link to provider store on the buyer app so that seller can verify the store on buyer app (one-time only after catalog for provider successfully ingested);
            * Option for buyer NP to communicate promotions to provider (as & when required);
            * On unsuccessful ingestion of the response:
            * Appropriate error message which can help seller NP to diagnose & fix the /on_search response;
/on_search (ACK response)
"response":
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"on_search",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "ack":
    {
      "status":"ACK",
      "tags":
      [
        {
          "code":"bap_provider_link[509]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"provider_id",
              "value":"P1"
            },
            {
              "code":"location_id",
              "value":"L1"
            },
            {
              "code":"sku_count",
              "value":"1000[510]"
            },
            {
              "code":"link1_type[511]",
              "value":"android"
            },
            {
              "code":"link1_value",
              "value":"https://buyerNP.com/p1l1a"
            },
            {
              "code":"link2_type",
              "value":"ios"
            },
            {
              "code":"link2_value",
              "value":"https://buyerNP.com/p1l1i"
            },
            {
              "code":"link3_type",
              "value":"web"
            },
            {
              "code":"link3_value",
              "value":"https://buyerNP.com/p1l1w.htm"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"bap_provider_link",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"provider_id",
              "value":"P1"
            },
            {
              "code":"location_id",
              "value":"L2"
            },
            {
              "code":"sku_count",
              "value":"1000[512]"
            },
            {
              "code":"link1_type[513]",
              "value":"android"
            },
            {
              "code":"link1_value",
              "value":"https://buyerNP.com/p1l1a"
            },
            {
              "code":"link2_type",
              "value":"ios"
            },
            {
              "code":"link2_value",
              "value":"https://buyerNP.com/p1l1i"
            },
            {
              "code":"link3_type",
              "value":"web"
            },
            {
              "code":"link3_value",
              "value":"https://buyerNP.com/p1l1w.htm"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"bap_promos",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"category",
              "value":"Grocery[514]"
            },
            {
              "code":"from",
              "value":"2023-05-28T00:00:00.000Z[515]"
            },
            {
              "code":"to",
              "value":"2023-05-28T23:59:00.000Z[516]"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
________________
/on_search (NACK response)
"response":
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"on_search",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "ack":
    {
      "status":"NACK",
    }
  },
  "error":
  {
    "type":"DOMAIN-ERROR",
    "code":"20000",
    "message":"appropriate error message"
  }
________________
Scenarios
1. SNP NACKs search request because buyer finder fee is not acceptable
"response":
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"search",[fq]
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "ack":
    {
      "status":"NACK",
      "tags":
      [
        {
          "code":"bpp_terms",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"finder_fee_type",
              "value":"percent"
            },
            {
              "code":"finder_fee_amount_min[517]",
              "value":"1.5"
            },
            {
              "code":"finder_fee_amount_max",
              "value":"2.5"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "error":
  {
    "type":"DOMAIN-ERROR",
    "code":"41001"
  }
________________
Incremental catalog refresh[fr]
            * Incremental refresh will only include the following:
            * Item(s) changes - entire item record to be sent when there are delta changes since the last full catalog snapshot; 
            * Store temporarily closed for online orders;
            * Store (i.e. provider location) disabling;
            * Provider / Merchant disabling;
            * Offers;
            * Disabling & enabling of customization groups, custom menu, variants will be through the full catalog refresh;
            * Each catalog update, through incremental refresh, will be versioned using a timestamp. This will be used by buyer NPs to resolve update conflicts between full & incremental catalog refresh;
            * To enable buyer NPs to distinguish between full vs incremental catalog response, a custom response header can be used by seller NPs:
            * "X-ONDC-Search-Response:inc" - for incremental response;
            * "X-ONDC-Search-Response:full" - for full response;[fs][ft]
            * Since incremental catalog changes are sent directly to buyer NP, the auth header will only have the signature of the Seller NP (and not include the gateway signature in x-gateway-authorization);
            * Buyer NPs that didn’t request for incremental catalog changes should respond with NACK for all incremental catalog changes received;
            * No new provider(s) / location(s) will be a part of incremental refresh;[fu]
            * In the sync ACK/NACK response to incremental catalog refresh, buyer NP can communicate whether the refresh was successfully ingested or not and the error codes & message format are defined below;
Payload below aggregates all possible use-cases. Individual use-case examples are below.
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"on_search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*[518]",

    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",

________________
Scenarios
Examples for individual use-cases are below, composite use-case will aggregate the applicable payloads;
1. Item changes
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"on_search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:30:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/provider[fx][fy][fz][ga][gb][gc][gd][ge][gf]s":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "items":
          [
            {
              "id":"I1",
              "time":
              {
                "label":"enable",
                "timestamp":"2023-06-03T07:30:00.000Z[530]"
              },[gg][gh]
              "parent_item_id[531]":"V1",
              "descriptor":
              {
                "name":"Plain Atta",
                "code":"1:XXXXXXXXXXXXX",
                "symbol":"https://sellerNP.com/images/i1.png",
                "short_desc":"Plain Atta",
                "long_desc":"Plain Atta",
                "images":
                [
                  "https://sellerNP.com/images/i1.png"
                ]
              },
              "quantity":
              {
                "unitized":
                {
                  "measure":
                  {
                    "unit":"kilogram",
                    "value":"1"
                  }
                },
                "available":[gi][gj]
                {
                  "count":"99"
                },
                "maximum":
                {
                  "count":"99"
                }
              },
              "price":
              {
                "currency":"INR",
                "value":"65.00",
                "maximum_value":"65.0"
              },
              "category_id":"Foodgrains",
              "fulfillment_id":"F1",
              "location_id":"L1",
              "@ondc/org/returnable":true,
              "@ondc/org/cancellable":true,
              "@ondc/org/return_window":"PT1H",
              "@ondc/org/seller_pickup_return":true,
              "@ondc/org/time_to_ship":"PT45M",
              "@ondc/org/available_on_cod":false,
              "@ondc/org/contact_details_consumer_care": "Ramesh,ramesh@abc.com,18004254444",
              "@ondc/org/statutory_reqs_packaged_commodities":
              {
                "manufacturer_or_packer_name":"ITC",
                "manufacturer_or_packer_address":"ITC Quality Care Cell,P.O Box No.592,Bangalore-560005",
                "common_or_generic_name_of_commodity":"Ashirwad Atta",
                "net_quantity_or_measure_of_commodity_in_pkg":"1kg",
                "month_year_of_manufacture_packing_import":"01/2023"
              },
              "@ondc/org/statutory_reqs_prepackaged_food":
              {
                "nutritional_info":"Energy(KCal)-(per 100kg) 420,(per serving 50g)250;Protein(g)-(per 100kg) 12,(per serving 50g) 6",
                "additives_info":"Preservatives,Artificial Colours",
                "brand_owner_FSSAI_license_no":"12345678901234",
                "other_FSSAI_license_no":"12345678901234",
                "importer_FSSAI_license_no":"12345678901234"
              },
              "tags[gk][gl]":
              [
                {
                  "code":"origin",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"country",
                      "value":"IND"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "code":"image[532]",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"type",
                      "value":"back_image"
                    },
                    {
                      "code":"url",
                      "value":"https://sellerNP.com/images/i1_back_image.png"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "code":"veg_nonveg",
                  "list":
                  [
                    {
                      "code":"veg",
                      "value":"yes"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
            1. Whenever there is any change in an item, i.e. changes in inventory, price, quantity, etc., the corresponding item record, as in the full catalog refresh, will be a part of the incremental refresh;
            2. The item record shown above is for grocery (ONDC:RET10); however, for any category (i.e. F&B, fashion, etc.), the corresponding item record will be included in the incremental refresh;
            3. Only item(s) that have changed or new item(s) added will be a part of the incremental refresh. Item(s) for which there are no changes should not be included in the incremental refresh;
________________
2. Store closed temporarily[533]
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",[gm][gn]
    "action":"on_search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:30:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/providers":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "locations":
          [
            {
              "id":"L1",
              "time":
              {
                "label":"close",
                "timestamp":"2023-06-03T10:20:00.000Z[go][gp]",[gq][gr][gs][gt]
                "range[534]":
                {
                  "start":"2023-06-03T16:00:00.000Z",
                  "end[535]":"2023-06-03T23:59:00.000Z"[gu][gv]
                }
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
               1. Any subsequent incremental catalog refresh that happens, when the store remains closed, may have updates for the items for that store. Buyer NP should process this so that the updated items are visible when the store reopens;
               2. Any subsequent full catalog refresh that happens, when the store remains closed, will have the store marked as closed, along with the other details that are a part of the full catalog;
________________
3. Store reopening
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"on_search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-09-05T08:30:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/providers":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "locations":
          [
            {
              "id":"L1",
              "time":
              {
                "label":"open",
                "timestamp":"2023-09-05T08:30:00.000Z"
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                  1. Following states can be passed for a store in the catalog refresh:
                  1. open - open an already enabled store:
                  * using full / incremental catalog refresh;
                  * using time.label="open", time.timestamp = event timestamp;
                  * store will be shown as open after the buyer NP processes the incremental refresh;
                  * after the store reopens, it will default to the normal store timings;
                  * if used for disabled store, buyer NP can NACK with error code 20004;
                  2. close - close an already enabled store:
                  * using full / incremental catalog refresh;
                  * using time.label="close", time.timestamp = event timestamp, time.range.start = start datetime[gw][gx] for closure, time.range.end is optional;
                  * if time.range.end is not passed, the store will remain closed until it is marked as open in a subsequent catalog refresh (incremental or full);
                  3. enable - for activation of store by buyer NP or for updating other information including serviceability, items, store timing, etc.:
                  * using full catalog refresh (for now);
                  * using time.label="enable", time.timestamp = event timestamp;
                  * store timings using:
                  * time.days + time.schedule.holidays + ((time.range.start + time.range.end) or (time.frequency + time.times)) (1.2 phase 1);
                  * provider.timing (1.2 phase 2);
                  * store timings (using option for 1.2 phase 1) has been deprecated in 1.2;
                  4. disable - for soft-delete of store by buyer NP:
                  * using full / incremental catalog refresh;
                  * using time.label="disable", time.timestamp = event timestamp;
                  2. Since the store states "enable" & "close" are mutually exclusive, usage of the same keys (time.range.start + time.range.end) for store timings & store close for the interim will need to be handled;
                  3. Any subsequent incremental catalog refresh that happens, when the store remains closed, may have updates for the items for that store. Buyer NP should process this so that the updated items are visible when the store reopens;
                  4. Any subsequent full catalog refresh that happens, when the store remains closed, will have the store marked as closed, along with the other details that are a part of the full catalog;
________________
4. Provider disabling
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"on_search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:30:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/providers":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "time":
          {
            "label":"disable",
            "timestamp":"2023-06-03T10:20:00.000Z"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                     1. No items should be sent for a provider that is being disabled;


________________
5. Store disabling
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"on_search",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:30:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "catalog":
    {
      "bpp/providers":
      [
        {
          "id":"P1",
          "locations":
          [
            {
              "id":"L1",
              "time":
              {
                "label":"disable",[gy][gz]
                "timestamp":"2023-06-03T10:20:00.000Z"
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                     1. If a store is disabled, serviceability for the store shouldn’t be sent in the full catalog;
________________

________________
/on_search sync response (ACK, NACK)
In the sync response to incremental catalog refresh /on_search, the buyer NP can send ACK or NACK:
                     * ACK means refresh was successfully ingested;
                     * NACK means refresh couldn’t be ingested and could happen because the incremental refresh being shared for specific provider(s) / location(s) / item(s) are not found on the buyer NP cache or for other reasons. Buyer NP should use these error codes / message in the NACK response:
                     * Provider not found - error code 20003, error message should have provider id delimited by comma, e.g. "[{provider_id:P1},{provider_id:P2},{provider_id:P3}]" (means provider ids P1, P2, P3 are not found);
                     * Provider location not found - error code 20004, error message should have provider & location ids delimited by comma, e.g. "[{provider_id:P1,location_id:L1}, {provider_id:P2,location_id:L2}]" (means location id L1 for provider id P1, location id L2 for provider id P2 are not found);
                     * Item not found[ha][hb] - error code 20005, error message should have provider & item ids delimited by comma, e.g. "[{provider_id:P1,item_id:I1}, {provider_id:P2,item_id:I2}]" (means item id I1 for provider id P1, item id I2 for provider id P2 are not found);[hc][hd]
                     * for a combination of the above errors, error codes should be delimited by comma and above error messages combined in stringified json, e.g. if the following not found:
                     * provider location L3 for provider P1
                     * item id I3 for provider P2
                     * error code - "20004,20005" and error message - "[{provider_id:P1,location_id:L3}, {provider_id:P2,item_id:I3}]"
                     * for all other cases, error code 20000, error message will be a text string describing the error;
/on_search (NACK response)
"response":
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"*",
    "action":"on_search",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:00:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "ack":
    {
      "status":"NACK",
    }
  },
  "error":
  {
    "type":"DOMAIN-ERROR",
    "code":"20000",
    "message":"appropriate error message"
  }
________________
/select
                     * Following enhancements are included:
                     * Customizations with dynamic item ID;
                     * Offer(s) opt-in by the buyer;
                     * Payment on delivery option selected by buyer;
Scenarios
1. Buyer creates make-to-order product - Domino’s Pizza (example 1 above)
In this example:
                     * Buyer selects the following:
                     * Dynamic Item 1 - Farmhouse Pizza with Crust ("New Hand Tossed"), Size ("Large"), Toppings ("Grilled Mushrooms", "Pepper Barbeque Chicken");[he]
                     * Dynamic Item 2 - Farmhouse Pizza with Crust ("100% Wheat Thin Crust"), Size ("Large"), Toppings ("Grilled Mushrooms", "Fresh Tomato");
                     * IDs & prices for the above:
                     * Dynamic Item 1:
                     * Farmhouse Pizza with Crust ("New Hand Tossed") - ₹269
                     * Size ("Large") - ₹450
                     * Toppings ("Grilled Mushrooms" - ₹80, "Pepper Barbeque Chicken" - ₹95)
                     * Dynamic Item 2:
                     * Farmhouse Pizza with Crust ("100% Wheat Thin Crust") - ₹269
                     * Size ("Large") - ₹450
                     * Toppings ("Grilled Mushrooms" - ₹80, "Fresh Tomato" - ₹80)

N.B.
                     1. In the above example, the buyer selection is as follows:
                     1. Dynamic item - DI1
                     1. Item - I1 (count 1)
                     * Customization group - CG1, customization - C1
                     * Customization group - CG2, customization - C7
                     * Customization group - CG3, customization - C14, C16
                     2. Dynamic item - DI2
                     1. Item - I1 (count 1)
                     * Customization group - CG1, customization - C2
                     * Customization group - CG2, customization - C7
                     * Customization group - CG3, customization - C14, C15
                     2. /select includes buyer selection of base items & customizations;
                     3. Base item & all customizations, for a selection, are grouped using a dynamic item id;
                     4. If there is a change in delivery address, the buyer app is required to call /select again;
                     5. If there is a change in cart in /on_init (i.e. due to reduction in item quantity), the buyer app is required to call /select again;
________________

N.B.
                        1. If there is a change in delivery address, the buyer app is required to call /select again;
                        2. If there is a change in cart in /on_init (i.e. due to reduction in item quantity), the buyer app is required to call /select again;
________________
/on_select
                        * Following enhancements are included in the quote:
                        * Cost for product customizations;
                        * Offer code(s) applied;
                        * Support for 2 fulfillment types (Delivery, Self-Pickup);
                        * Adding fulfillment_type to Fulfillment;
                        * Support for multiple categories in each fulfillment type;
                        * Provider location id will be (optionally) returned in /on_select. This will be required in cases where the fulfillment cannot be done from the location selected by the buyer but from a different location for the provider, as typically happens in non-hyperlocal categories. If this happens, the buyer NP should display a message to the buyer and use the updated location in /init;
                        * Added (optional) quote type for quote line item for fulfillment level tax, order/fulfillment level offer;
                        * Rules for quote:
                        * Seller NP is required to perform check for serviceability & inventory, for the /select request, and return appropriate response as detailed here;
                        * Order quote should comply with the following:
                        * All product prices (title_type "item") should have both total & unit prices (as shown here);
                        * Precision for all prices in quote can be up to 2 decimal digits;
                        * Order value, i.e. quote.price.value = Σ quote line items, i.e. quote.breakup[].price.value;
                        * Total price for an item (title type "item") should match the unit price for the item * quantity for the item in the quote;
                        * Quote provided here for order is not frozen until /on_init. In case there is change in cart selection in /on_init (i.e. change in item(s) and /or quantity or change in buyer fulfillment address), the buyer NP will be required to call /select again;
                        * If cart value is less than minimum order value[hs][ht][hu][hv][hw], seller NP can return error code 30023 and the buyer NP may use this to prompt the buyer[hx][hy] to increase the order value to at least reach the minimum order value;
________________
Scenarios[hz][ia][ib][ic]
1. If item is in stock & buyer location serviceable

4. Quote for product with customizations (response to scenario for /select above)
{
  "context":

    "domain":"ONDC:RET11",
    "action":"on_select",

        "ttl":"PT1H"
