  },
  "error[578]":
  {
    "type":"DOMAIN-ERROR",
    "code":"40002",
    "message":"stringified json formatted as in point 7 below"
  }
}
N.B.
                              1. /on_select returns quote for each dynamic item component (i.e. base item(s) & customizations), as selected by the buyer, along with fulfillment level costs;
                              2. For each base item & customization, the quote includes:
                              1. Item price - total & unit price
                              2. Available & maximum quantity
                              3. Tax
                              3. For customizations, the above quote structure will also be a part of the payloads in /on_init, /on_confirm, /on_update, /on_cancel;
                              4. In case a customization is out-of-stock, the quantity should be 0 and the total price for the customization will be 0;
                              5. If any mandatory customization is out-of-stock or the required minimum quantity is not available, the buyer NP can prompt the buyer to select a different customization (for the same customization group and matching the veg/non-veg/egg type of the original customization selected by buyer);
                              6. If any optional customization is out-of-stock or the quantity selected is not available, the quote should have the customization with the quantity available, but the base item and other customizations will have the quantity as selected by the buyer;
                              7. For all of the cases in 4 & 5 above, error.message in the response should have the list of corresponding item ids referenced in stringified object notation, e.g. if base item "I1" for dynamic item "DI1" and customization "C15" for dynamic item "DI2" are both out of stock, error.message would be encoded as: "[{\"dynamic_item_id\":\"DI1\",\"item_id\":\"I1\",\"error\":\"40002\"}, {\"dynamic_item_id\":\"DI2\",\"customization_id\":\"C15\",\"customization_group_id\":\"CG3\",\"error\":\"40002\"}]". This is in addition to the error.code (40002) which is being sent by seller NP;
                              8. If there is a mismatch between the list of ids in 7 & the ids in quote with quantity less than requested or 7 is not honoured, the buyer NP can NACK /on_select with error code 22507;
________________
5. Offers
                              * Available offers may be a part of the catalog for the buyer NP to render:
                              * Offers may be:
                              * opt-in - buyer applies offer to their cart selection by entering offer id(s) prior to checkout;
                              * auto-applied - offers are automatically applied;
                              * As part of /select processing, SNP evaluates offers for which buyer is eligible (regardless of applicability of such offers) and sends details of these offers in /on_select;
                              * provider will validate the offer id(s), for opt-in offers, and apply the offer(s) to the cart selection;
                              * auto-applied offers will be shown in the offer quote. If buyer doesn’t want any auto-applied offer, they can remove the offer from the cart and buyer NP will communicate this to seller NP in /select, /init,  /confirm;
                              * Handling of exception conditions for offers:
                              * if offer is no longer valid in pre-order APIs such as /on_init or /on_confirm, seller NP can send error code 30006;
                              * if offer is valid but cannot be fulfilled (e.g. offer item not available for offers such as freebie, etc.), seller NP can send error code 30007;
                              * if offer is no longer valid or cannot be fulfilled in /on_confirm, seller NP should cancel the order;
5.1. Offer (based on cart selection)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET11",
    "action":"on_select",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",

6. Enabling Self-Pickup / Buyer-Delivery
                              * Provider will define whether a store supports delivery, self-pickup or both options, along with the timings for delivery, self-pickup (/on_search);
                              * Provider may also define minimum order value (/on_search);
                              * Seller NP will forward delivery (only if pickup & delivery locations serviceable), self-pickup option for buyer to select;
                              * Delivery option will have an O2D TAT while a self-pickup option will have the O2S TAT;
                              * For backward compatibility, the default functionality will be set as follows - delivery will be the 1st fulfillment option, (with the Seller NP assigning this delivery option for the items), but the quote will include the cost for both delivery & self-pickup types (including "delivery", "packing", "tax" (with quote type "fulfillment"), as applicable);
                              * Buyer NP should check the default fulfillment(s) assigned to item(s) and extract the cost only for these fulfillment(s), from the quote, for displaying to the buyer along with other line items such as item, tax, etc;
                              * Buyer can change the fulfillment option to self-pickup and this will be updated in /init:
                              * when the buyer selects a fulfillment option, among options provided by the seller NP, the selected fulfillment option will be communicated in /init. In this case, the selected fulfillment option will impact the quote and the quote in /on_init will be different from the quote in /on_select;
                              * BNP will need to validate that the updated quote in /on_init matches the quote in /on_select after adjusting for the changes in quote due to the fulfillment option selected e.g. if /on_select quote included a value for delivery charge and this was the default fulfillment option and the buyer selects self-pickup, the updated quote should have a delivery charge of 0 in /on_init;
                              * If cart selection changes (i.e. change in items and / or quantity), buyer NP needs to call /select;
                              * Seller NP should check that the quote in /confirm matches the last quote sent in /on_init;
                              * In case of self-pickup:
                              * after the order is ready for pickup (by seller), it is marked as ready;
                              * pickup code will be generated by seller NP and communicated to the buyer NP;
                              * authorization code (OTP, etc.) may optionally be generated by seller NP and communicated to the buyer NP;
                              * additional details that may be required to be communicated over the protocol include vehicle no for whoever is picking up the order (i.e. buyer for curbside self-pickup);
                              * instructions if any (e.g. with register / counter no for buyer self-pickup);

  "context":
  {

________________
7. Slotted delivery / pickup options
                              * Seller NP will forward all fulfilment options in different types (delivery, self-pickup) to buyer to select;
                              * For backward compatibility, the default functionality will be set as follows - option(s) for "Delivery" type will be the default fulfillment option, (with the Seller NP assigning this delivery type for the items), but the quote will include the cost for all options for both delivery & self-pickup types (including "delivery", "packing", "tax" as applicable);
                              * Buyer NP should check the default fulfillment(s) assigned to item(s) and extract the cost only for these fulfillment(s), from the quote, for displaying to the buyer NP along with other line items such as item, tax, etc;
                              * Buyer can select a different fulfillment option for Delivery or Self-Pickup and this will be updated in /init;
                              * Each option will have:
                              * Delivery (either of the following):
                              * O2D TAT = max(O2S for all items) + S2D;
                              * Slot for delivery;
                              * Self-Pickup (either of the following):
                              * O2S TAT = max(O2S for all items);
                              * Slot for self pickup;
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET11",
    "action":"on_select",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M2",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T08:30:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order":
    {
      "provider":
      {
        "id":"P1"
      },

________________
/init
                              * Following enhancements are included:
                              * If buyer switches the fulfillment option(s), the updated fulfillment id will be sent in /init;
Scenarios

________________


/on_init
                              * Following enhancements are included:
                              * Cancellation terms
                              * Cancellation terms will be defined by the seller for the order and only apply if the complete order is being cancelled (using /cancel or /on_cancel), after order has been placed but before it is delivered;
                              * Cancellation terms need to be defined for all fulfillment states, for all reason codes, and include cancellation fees (if any);
                              * With cancellation terms enabled, order cancellation should be enabled for all fulfillment states, after order has been placed ("Pending") and before it is delivered ("Order-delivered");
                              * Configurable terms for transaction level contract;
Scenarios
1. For make-to-order product - Domino’s Pizza (response to /init above)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET11",
    "action":"on_init",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",

              "code":"max_liability",
              "value":"2"
            },
            {
              "code":"max_liability_cap",
              "value":"10000.00"
            },
            {
              "code":"mandatory_arbitration",
              "value":"false"
            },
            {
              "code":"court_jurisdiction",
              "value":"Bengaluru"
            },
            {
              "code":"delay_interest",
              "value":"7.50"
            },
            {
              "code":"tax_number[674]",
              "value":"gst_number_of_sellerNP"
            },
            {
              "code":"provider_tax_number[675]",
              "value":"PAN_number_of_provider"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                              1. Seller NP should perform an inventory & price check in /on_init. In case of item out of stock, error response should be same as in /on_select;
                              2. Seller NP may apply buyer-specific cashback offers (can only be applied only after the buyer is identified). These offers cannot be a part of the catalog and will be explicitly applied in /on_init, with title_type = "offer" and quote.breakup[].price.value having a negative value equal to the cashback; however, the rules in the previous section for item count / value for offer will still hold;
                              3. If /on_select returned multiple fulfillment options, the buyer may switch the fulfillment option from the default fulfillment(s) assigned in /on_select. In this case, the quote in /on_init will be updated based on the fulfillment option selected by buyer;
                              4. The quote in /on_init will be the final quote for the order prior to /confirm. Both seller NP & buyer NP respectively should validate that the quote in /confirm and /on_confirm matches the quote in /on_init (both for the total and for individual line items);
________________

/confirm

N.B.
                                 1. In case of pre-paid collection by the buyer / seller NP, the payment link is rendered after the buyer NP sends ACK for /on_init but before calling /confirm;
________________

________________
/on_confirm
Scenarios
1. For make-to-order product - Domino’s Pizza (response to /confirm above)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET11",
    "action":"on_confirm",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M4",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T09:30:30.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "state":"Accepted[754]",
      "provider":
      {
        "id":"P1",
        "locations":
        [
          {
            "id":"L1"
          }
        ]
      },
      "items":
      [
        {
          "id":"I1",
          "fulfillment_id":"F1",
          "quantity":
          {
            "count":1
          },
          "parent_item_id":"DI1",
          "tags":
          [
            {
              "code":"type",
              "list":
              [
                {
                  "code":"type",
                  "value":"item"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "id":"C1",
          "fulfillment_id":"F1",
          "quantity":
          {
            "count":1
          },
          "parent_item_id":"DI1",
          "tags":

            {
              "code":"type",
              "list":
              [
                {
                  "code":"type",
                  "value":"customization"
                }
              ]

              "code":"parent",
              "list":
              [

                  "code":"id",

                }

            }

          "fulfillment_id":"F1",
          "quantity":
          {
            "count":1

          "parent_item_id":"DI1",
          "tags":

________________
Rules for order confirmation
                                 1. /confirm and /on_confirm calls should be idempotent;
                                 2. Buyer NP will create the order id which will be unique across the network. In response to /confirm from buyer NP, seller NP sends /on_confirm with the same order_id;
                                 3. Buyer NP (BNP) sends /confirm, Seller NP (SNP) validates[804] order:
                                 1. if validation successful, SNP responds with ACK:
                                 1. SNP creates order (preferably with internal state to indicate order is being processed), but shouldn’t forward to merchant for processing & fulfillment;
                                 2. if validation not successful, SNP responds with NACK with error code 31002 (order validation failure):
                                 1. after BNP receives NACK, they should cancel the order with reason code 999 (order cancelled because of order confirmation failure);
                                 2. if this order is passed in subsequent API calls (/confirm, /status, /cancel, /update, etc.), SNP returns NACK with error code 30018 (order not found);
                                 3. SNP may also respond with NACK due to other internal errors (http 504, retriable error code 31001):
                                 1. BNP should retry[805] /confirm. If after the retry interval, BNP doesn’t receive ACK/NACK, they should cancel the order with reason code 999;
                                 4. if BNP doesn’t receive ACK/NACK or /on_confirm, they should retry /confirm (same as above). If within the retry interval, BNP doesn’t receive ACK/NACK or /on_confirm, they should cancel the order with reason code 999;
                                 4. SNP sends /on_confirm, BNP validates[806] order:
                                 1. if validation successful, BNP responds with ACK:
                                 1. SNP forwards order to merchant for processing & fulfillment;
                                 2. if validation not successful, BNP responds with NACK with error code 23002 (order validation failure):
                                 1. after SNP receives NACK, they should cancel the order with reason code 998 (order cancelled because of order confirmation failure) & push the status change to BNP;
                                 2. if this order (with cancellation state & reason code) is passed in subsequent API calls (/on_confirm, /on_status, /on_cancel, /on_update), BNP responds with ACK;
                                 3. BNP may also NACK due to internal errors (http 504/503, retriable error code 23001):
                                 1. SNP should retry[807] /on_confirm. If after the retry interval, SNP doesn’t receive ACK/NACK, they should cancel the order with reason code 998;
                                 2. If order is passed in subsequent API calls within the retry window (/status, /track, /cancel, /update), SNP responds with current order state along with error code 31003 to indicate order processing in progress;
                                 3. If order is passed in subsequent API calls after cancellation (/status, /cancel, /update), SNP sends response with order state as cancelled;
                                 4. If SNP doesn’t receive ACK/NACK for /on_confirm, they should retry /on_confirm. If after the retry interval, SNP doesn’t receive ACK/NACK, they should cancel the order with reason code 998;
________________


/update & /on_update
Scenario 1 - Part cancel by merchant[ok]
                                 * Cancel of item(s) can only be initiated if fulfillment state is "Pending";
                                 * A separate fulfillment is created for the cancellation and the item & quantity assigned to it. This fulfillment also has associated details such as cancellation reason code, quote trail;
                                 * Updated quote is provided by the seller NP at the refund trigger point ("Liquidated", "Return_Picked", "Cancelled") and the buyer NP can calculate the amount of refund from the quote trail;
/on_update (merchant cancels customized product DI1, qty 1)

N.B.
                                 1. A dynamic item comprises a base item and one or more customizations. The quantity of a dynamic item will be the same as the corresponding quantity for the base item and the quantity for customizations will be defined as per configuration of the customization group, for the customization. For part cancel of dynamic item for specific quantity, the base item and customizations should be cancelled in the same proportion and the quote updated accordingly:
e.g. for an order O1:
dynamic item (DI1) includes (item type, quantity):
I1 - 3
C1 - 3
C2 - 3


=> DI1 has qty 3 and each DI1 includes:
I1 - 1
C1 - 1
C2 - 1


(part cancel for 1 qty of DI1 should include the above and the quote / quote trail should be updated accordingly)
                                 2. For customized product, seller NP needs to cancel the dynamic item and set the quantity & total price to 0 for all item & customization components;
                                 3. Individual item or customization components can’t be part-cancelled;
                                 4. If either of 1 or 2 is not followed, buyer NP should NACK the /on_update with error code 22508;
                                 5. For merchant part-cancel, the buyer NP may send NACK with error code 22501 (if the buyer does not accept part fill for the order). In this case, the seller NP will be required to rollback this part cancel request and cancel the full order;
________________

/update (settlement trail for refund initiation)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M6",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T11:00:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "update_target":"payment",
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "fulfillments":
      [
        {
          "id":"C1",
          "type":"Cancel"
        }
      ],
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/settlement_details":
        [
          {
            "settlement_counterparty":"buyer",
            "settlement_phase":"refund",
            "settlement_type":"upi",
            "settlement_amount":"170.00",
            "settlement_timestamp":"2023-06-03T11:00:00.000Z"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                                 1. Since this is an FYI for the seller NP, there will be no callback corresponding to this request;
________________
Scenario 2 - Return with reverse QC
                                    * Return of items can only be initiated when fulfillment state is "Order-delivered";
                                    * Return of an item can only be initiated within the return window for the item (as defined in the catalog);
                                    * Return with reverse QC can transition through either of the following state changes:
                                    * Scenario A - Return approved, Return pick successful:
                                    * Return_Initiated -> Return_Approved -> Return_Picked (refund triggered here) -> Return_Delivered
                                    * Return_Initiated -> Return_Approved -> Return_Pick_Failed -> Return_Picked (refund triggered here) -> Return_Delivered
                                    * Scenario B - Return approved, Return failed:
                                    * Return_Initiated -> Return_Approved -> Return_Pick_Failed -> Return_Failed
                                    * Scenario C - Return rejected:
                                    * Return_Initiated -> Return_Rejected
                                    * It is assumed that the LSP assigned for return pickup will have a certain no of pickup attempts and will trigger scenario B after all pickup attempts failed;
/update (buyer initiated part return request for item I1, qty 1)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M6",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T10:30:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "update_target":"item[835]",
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "fulfillments":
      [
        {
          "type":"Return[836]",
          "tags":
          [
            {
              "code":"return_request",[ov][ow]
              "list":
              [
                {
                  "code":"id",
                  "value":"R1[837]"
                },[ox][oy]
                {
                  "code":"item_id",
                  "value":"I1"[oz][pa][pb]
                },
                {
                  "code":"parent_item_id[838]",
                  "value":"DI1"
                },
                {
                  "code":"item_quantity",
                  "value":"1"
                },
                {
                  "code":"reason_id[839]",
                  "value":"003"
                },
                {
                  "code":"reason_desc",
                  "value":"detailed description for return[840]"
                },
                {
                  "code":"images",
                  "value":"url_for_image1,url_for_image2"
                },
                {
                  "code":"ttl_approval[pc][pd][pe][pf][841]",
                  "value":"PT24H"
                },
                {
                  "code":"ttl_reverseqc[842]",
                  "value":"P3D"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                                    1. If return reason code is invalid, seller NP can send NACK with error code 30005;

/on_update (seller NP approves request & wants item back)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"on_update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M7",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T13:30:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "state":"Completed",
      "provider":
      {
        "id":"P1",
        "locations":
        [
          {
            "id":"L1"
          }
        ]
      },
      "items":
      [

               },
               {
                 "code":"value",
                 "value":"0.00"
               }
             ]
           }
         ]
       }
     ],
     "quote":
     {
       "price":
       {
         "currency":"INR",
         "value":"254.00"
       },
       "breakup":
       [
         {
           "@ondc/org/item_id":"I1",

             "count":1

/update (settlement trail for refund initiation)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M11",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-05T12:00:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "update_target":"payment",
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "fulfillments":
      [
        {
          "id":"R1",
          "type":"Return"
        }
      ],
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/settlement_details":
        [
          {
            "settlement_counterparty":"buyer",
            "settlement_phase":"refund",
            "settlement_type":"upi",
            "settlement_amount":"170.00",
            "settlement_timestamp":"2023-06-05T12:00:00.000Z"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}
________________
Scenario 3 - Return with liquidation
                                    * Return of items can only be initiated when fulfillment state (for item) is "Order-delivered";
                                    * Return of an item can only be initiated within the return window for the item (as defined in the catalog);
                                    * Return with liquidation can transition through either of the following state changes:
                                    * Scenario A - Return liquidated:
                                    * Return_Initiated -> Liquidated (refund triggered here)
                                    * Scenario B - Return rejected:
                                    * Return_Initiated -> Return_Rejected
/update (buyer initiated part return request for item I1, qty 1)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M6",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T10:30:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "update_target":"item",
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "fulfillments":
      [
        {
          "type":"Return[934]",
          "tags":
          [
            {
              "code":"return_request",
              "list":
              [
                {
                  "code":"id",
                  "value":"R1[935]"[pw][px][py][pz][qa][qb][qc][qd]
                },
                {
                  "code":"item_id",
                  "value":"I1[qe][qf]"
                },
                {
                  "code":"parent_item_id[936]",
                  "value":"DI1"
                },
                {
                  "code":"item_quantity",
                  "value":"1"
                },
                {
                  "code":"reason_id[937]",
                  "value":"003"
                },
                {
                  "code":"reason_desc",
                  "value":"detailed description for return[938]"
                },
                {
                  "code":"images",
                  "value":"url_for_image1,url_for_image2"
                },
                {
                  "code":"ttl_approval[qg][939]",
                  "value":"PT24H[qh]"
                },
                {
                  "code":"ttl_reverseqc[940]",
                  "value":"P3D"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                                    1. If return reason code is invalid, seller NP can send NACK with error code 30005;
________________

/update (settlement trail for refund initiated)
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M8",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T13:30:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "update_target":"payment",
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "fulfillments":
      [
        {
          "id":"R1",
          "type":"Return"
        }
      ],
      "payment":
      {
        "@ondc/org/settlement_details":
        [
          {
            "settlement_counterparty":"buyer",
            "settlement_phase":"refund",
            "settlement_type":"upi",
            "settlement_amount":"170.00",
            "settlement_timestamp":"2023-06-03T13:30:00.000Z"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }

________________
Scenario 4 - update for fulfillment(s)
                                    * Applicable for fulfillment type "Buyer-Delivery" (i.e. logistics thru buyer NP);
                                    * Can also be used for cancelling fulfillment(s);
                                    * Request for update can be sent for 1 or more existing fulfillment, that hasn’t reached terminal[980] state;
                                    * /on_update response will be solicited, i.e. in response to /update;
/update
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"update",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T1",
    "message_id":"M10",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-11-17T10:00:00.000Z"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "update_target":"fulfillment",
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "fulfillments":
      [
        {
          "id":"F3[981]",
          "tags":
          [
            {
              "code":"update_state[982]",
              "list":
              [
                {
                  "code":"state",
                  "value":"Order-picked-up[983]"
                },
                {
                  "code":"reason_id",
                  "value":"007[984]"
                }
              ]
            },

                {

                  "value":"3"
                },

                  "value":"013[987]"
                },

                  "code":"initiated_by",
                  "value":"lsp.com[988]"
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "code":"update_fulfillment_time[989]",
              "list":
              [

                  "code":"state",
                  "value":"Order-picked-up[990]"

                  "value":"2023-11-17T09:00:00.000Z"
                },

                  "code":"end_time[993]",

  "context":

________________
Rules for part return & cancel
                                    1. An order is frozen at its terminal state ("Completed", "Cancelled"), with no further updates, except for the following:
                                    1. With order.state = "Completed", there may be return of 1 or more items, within the return window for these items. For every return request, a separate fulfillment is created to track the return request and the refund associated with the return request;
                                    2. Order & fulfillment state, for forward shipment fulfillment, is set to "Cancelled", whenever RTO is initiated for an order;
                                    3. Changes to the order due to return / RTO are defined in the contract for the corresponding APIs;
                                    2. Response for part-return should have exactly the same number of items for which return is requested;
                                    3. Order value (quote.price.value) cannot increase through /on_update. If order value decreases, it should be due to decrease in item quantity (quote.breakup[]."@ondc/org/item_quantity".count) for "@ondc/org/title_type" of "item";
                                    4. Quote trail is immutable after it is added to the order at the refund trigger point;
                                    5. /on_update should return the same information as /on_status i.e. the audit trail for items (including returns, cancels processed or in-progress), the current state of order items & fulfillment, order quote and breakup, settlement trail (if available);
                                    6. /on_update (solicited or unsolicited) should be called whenever there is a change in the order details (e.g. due to buyer return or cancellation). Whenever there is a status change, an unsolicited /on_status call should be made;
                                    7. Batching of order updates & status changes should not be done;
________________
/cancel
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"cancel",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M10",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T11:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order_id":"O1",
    "cancellation_reason_id":"006[1022]",
    "descriptor[1023]":
    {
      "name":"fulfillment",
      "short_desc":"F1[1024]",
      "tags[1025]":
      [
        {
          "code":"params",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"force[1026]",
              "value":"no[1027]"
            },
            {
              "code":"ttl_response[1028]",
              "value":"PT1H"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                                       1. If cancellation_reason_id is invalid (i.e. doesn’t exist or isn’t applicable for buyer NP), seller NP can NACK /cancel with error code 30012;
                                       2. Cancellation can be initiated by buyer NP on fulfillment TAT breach with cancellation_reason_id "006" and with the appropriate fulfillment id as shown above. If seller NP determines that fulfillment TAT is not breached, they can NACK /cancel with error code 30014;
                                       3. Force cancellation flow here;
________________

N.B.
                                          1. Merchant can initiate cancellation of order using /on_cancel by setting order state & all fulfillment states to "Cancelled";
                                          2. Merchant can cancel fulfillment using /on_cancel by setting corresponding fulfillment state to "Cancelled";
                                          3. Buyer NP can initiate cancellation either for order or fulfillment; for cancellation of order, all corresponding fulfillments need to be cancelled;
                                          4. If cancellation_reason_id is not valid for unsolicited /on_cancel (i.e. not one of the cancellation reasons that can be used by seller NP), buyer app may NACK /on_cancel with error code 22502;
                                          5. If updated quote does not match the original order value with the cancellation terms[qq][qr] applied, buyer NP may NACK /on_cancel with error code 22503;
________________
/on_cancel (RTO flow)
RTO will be initiated at the fulfillment level due to either of the following:
                                             * buyer does not accept the fulfillment;
                                             * buyer cannot be located for their fulfillment to be delivered;
                                             * merchant / LSP inability to deliver because of natural calamities, vehicle breakdown, etc.;
In case of RTO:
                                             * every fulfillment will identify whether RTO results in actual return to origin;
                                             * buyers are within their rights to RTO, if the fulfillment is delivered beyond the fulfillment TAT, thus constituting a TAT breach;
                                             * in the event of RTO, without any breach of fulfillment TAT, the Logistics Buyer NP may recover both the forward shipping cost as well as RTO costs from the Retail Buyer NP. In this case, the Logistics Provider may be expected to help establish that the buyer refused to accept or was not available / couldn’t be contacted to accept delivery;
RTO process flow is as follows:
                                             * LSP tries to deliver the order to the buyer (it is assumed that a certain number of retries are built in for all deliveries except immediate delivery). Typical number of retries is 3 per industry standard;
                                             * Buyer does not accept the order or is unreachable / unavailable at the mentioned shipping address on attempt to deliver the order;
                                             * LSP initiates cancellation of logistics order, through /on_cancel, and provides specific reason code as defined here and AWB no (for forward shipment, if applicable);
                                             * Calling Logistics /on_cancel with reason code (that triggers RTO as defined in the reason codes) will initiate RTO and result in the following:
                                             * addition of new fulfillment record for the logistics order, with fulfillment start location / time, fulfillment state set to "RTO-Initiated";
                                             * quote for RTO may be added to the original quote (for forward shipment), matching the quote provided in logistics /on_search;
                                             * order state will be set to "Cancelled";
                                             * If LSP initiates a valid RTO request (as determined by the reason code and above info provided), logistics buyer NP has to accept the request;
                                             * Logistics /on_cancel will also result in cascaded retail /on_cancel request, for the fulfillment, and include the new fulfillment record for RTO, fulfillment start location / time, fulfillment state, order state and quote for RTO (if buyer has to pay for the RTO cost as per the cancellation reason code);
                                             * After RTO delivery is completed, LSP updates fulfillment status for RTO fulfillment (to "RTO-Delivered"), fulfillment end time, etc. through /on_status and this is cascaded to the retail order;
                                             * In case of RTO without return, fulfillment state will be updated to "RTO-Disposed";
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "action":"on_cancel",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M10",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-03T11:00:30.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order":
    {
      "id":"O1",
      "state":"Cancelled[1036]",[qs]
      "provider":
      {
        "id":"P1",
        "locations":
        [
          {
            "id":"L1"
          }
        ]
      },
      "items[1037]":
      [
        {
          "id":"I1",
          "fulfillment_id":"F1",
          "quantity":
          {
            "count":0
          }
        },
        {
          "id":"I1",
          "fulfillment_id":"F1-RTO",
          "quantity":
          {
            "count":2[qt]
          }

/track
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET11[1050]",
    "action":"track",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M11",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-04T06:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order_id":"O1"
  }
}
N.B.
                                             1. Buyer NP will need to call /track to poll near real-time gps coordinates for the rider;
                                             2. /track should be called only after the rider is assigned for the order and preferably after "gps_enabled" is set to "yes", for the corresponding fulfillment, in /on_status.
                                             3. For non-hyperlocal tracking, SNP should set "url_enabled" to "yes" and "tracking_url", for the corresponding fulfillment, in /on_status;
                                             4. If /track is called for an order for which the rider is not yet assigned or rider is assigned but fulfillment tracking is not yet enabled (i.e. "gps_enabled" and / or "url_enabled" is "no") or disabled, the seller NP must return NACK with error code 40005;
________________
/on_track
{
  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET11",
    "action":"on_track",
    "country":"IND",
    "city":"std:080",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id":"T2",
    "message_id":"M11",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-04T06:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl":"PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "tracking":
    {
      "id":"F1[1051]",
      "location":
      {
        "gps[1052]":"12.974002,77.613458",
        "time":
        {
          "timestamp[1053]":"2023-06-02T06:20:00.000Z"
        },
        "updated_at[1054]":"2023-06-02T06:30:00.000Z"
      },
      "url":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc/tracking/F1[1055]",
      "status[1056]":"active",
      "tags[1057]":
      [
        {
          "code":"order[1058]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"id",
              "value":"O1"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"config[1059]",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"attr",
              "value":"tracking.location.gps[1060]"
            },
            {
              "code":"type",
              "value":"live_poll[1061]"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"path",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"lat_lng",
              "value":"12.974002,77.613458"
            },
            {
              "code":"sequence",
              "value":"1"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"path",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"lat_lng",
              "value":"12.974077,77.613600"
            },
            {
              "code":"sequence",
              "value":"2"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "code":"path",
          "list":
          [
            {
              "code":"lat_lng",
              "value":"12.974098,77.613699"
            },
            {
              "code":"sequence",
              "value":"3"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
N.B.
                                                1. To enable tracking:
                                                * Tracking should be enabled for the fulfillment for the order;
                                                * Tracking becomes active after rider is assigned for the order and becomes inactive after the order is delivered;
                                                * /on_track will be solicited response as explained above;
                                                * /track request & /on_track response are cascaded from retail seller NP to LSP & back;
________________
/status

  "context":
  {
    "domain":"ONDC:RET10",
    "action":"status",
    "core_version":"1.2.0",
    "bap_id":"buyerNP.com",
    "bap_uri":"https://buyerNP.com/ondc",
    "bpp_id":"sellerNP.com",
    "bpp_uri":"https://sellerNP.com/ondc",
    "transaction_id[1062]":"T2",
    "message_id":"M12",
    "city":"std:080",
    "country":"IND",
    "timestamp":"2023-06-04T10:00:00.000Z",
    "ttl": "PT30S"
  },
  "message":
  {
    "order_id":"O1"
  }

/on_status
Scenarios
1. For make-to-order product - Domino’s Pizza (response to /confirm above)

                "name":"my house or door or floor #",
                "building":"my building name or house #",
                "locality":"my street name",
                "city":"Bengaluru",
                "state":"Karnataka",
                "country":"IND",
                "area_code":"560037"
              }

N.B.
                                                   1. /on_status response can be solicited or unsolicited;
                                                   2. /on_status returns the audit trail for order items (including status of item returns, cancels processed or in-progress), the current state of order items & fulfillments, order quote & breakup;
                                                   3. Buyer app can send NACK for /on_status with error code for cases such as:
                                                   1. NACK received by seller app for /on_confirm but seller app sends /on_status to update order state to "Accepted";
                                                   4. In case of NACK received for /on_status, seller app should rollback order to previous state of the order, i.e. the state prior to sending /on_status;
________________
Fulfillment states & mapping to order states
                                                      1. Hyperlocal (P2P)
Fulfillment State
	When to assign state
	Order state
	"Pending"
	default fulfillment state
	"Created" or "Accepted"
	"Packed" 
	packed for shipping
	"In-progress"
	"Agent-assigned"
	rider assigned
	"In-progress"
	"Order-picked-up"[1133]
	order picked up by rider
	"In-progress"
	"Out-for-delivery"
	Out for delivery
	"In-progress"
	"Order-delivered"
	delivered
	"Completed"
	"Cancelled"
	cancelled
	"Cancelled"
	                                                      2. Intercity (P2H2P)[ry][rz]
Fulfillment State
	When to assign state
	Order state
	"Pending"
	default fulfillment state
	"Created" or "Accepted"
	"Packed" 
	packed for shipping
	"In-progress"
	"Agent-assigned"
	rider assigned
	"In-progress"
	"Out-for-pickup"
	out for pickup
	"In-progress"
	"Pickup-failed"
	pickup attempted but failed
	"In-progress"
	"Order-picked-up"
	picked up by rider
	"In-progress"
	"In-transit"
	at source hub
	"In-progress"
	"At-destination-hub"
	at destination hub
	"In-progress"
	"Out-for-delivery"
	Out for delivery
	"In-progress"
	"Delivery-failed"
	delivery attempted but failed
	"In-progress"
	"Order-delivered"
	delivered
	"Completed"
	"Cancelled"
	cancelled
	"Cancelled"
	                                                      3. RTO
Fulfillment State
	When to assign state
	Order state
	"RTO-Initiated"
	When RTO has been initiated
	Order state before RTO initiated
	"RTO-Disposed" 
	RTO terminal state when "return to origin" not required
	"Cancelled" (if all fulfillments cancelled) or "Completed"
	"RTO-Delivered"
	RTO terminal state when "return to origin" required 
	"Cancelled" (if all fulfillments cancelled) or "Completed"
	Updated domain namespace
                                                      * Existing domain will be migrated to separate domains for each category:

	Fashion

	BPC

	Pharma
	ONDC:RET19
