Mapping of title_type to quote (level) type
                                                      * Rules for mapping quote title_type to quote (level) type, e.g. "item" (product cost) only applies to quote (level) type "item" whereas "tax" may apply to quote (level) type "item" or "fulfillment":
title_type
	quote (level) type
	item
	item
	delivery
	fulfillment
	tax
	item, fulfillment
	packing
	fulfillment
	discount
	item, fulfillment, order
	misc
	fulfillment, order
	offer
	item, fulfillment, order
	________________
Transaction level contract
Overview
                                                      1. Purpose of the transaction level contract  between the participating NPs is explained here and includes the standard terms & conditions for the network participant(s);
                                                      2. The codified digital contract includes a set of configurable terms defined by the seller and a set of static terms which will be defined by the buyer NP (BNP);
                                                      3. A reference to these static terms will be a part of every online transaction between 2 participants;
                                                      4. Reference clauses to serve as a guide for participants to draft their static terms for the codified digital contract can be found here;
Proposed flow
                                                      1. Static terms will be version-controlled in GitHub repo:
                                                      1. All static terms will start with version 1.0.0 and subsequent changes will increment the version;
                                                      2. NP creates a PR for their static terms and ONDC will merge this PR and share the link with the NP:
                                                      1. NP forks the repository and creates a branch under the appropriate version, using the following naming convention:
                                                      * <NP name>_role e.g. "Pincode_BNP", "Magicpin_BNP", etc.;
                                                      2. NP merges their static terms into this branch;
                                                      3. NP creates PR for these changes;
                                                      2. Static terms can be published by NP on multiple channels e.g. their website, ONDC portal, etc.
                                                      3. Communication & acceptance of static terms:
                                                      1. Communication by BNP
                                                      1. BNP sends the following additional info as part of /search:
                                                      * current static terms link with version:
                                                      * for the very 1st set of static terms, this will be a blank link;
                                                      * new static terms link with version, if any:
                                                      * for the very 1st static terms, this will be the link for static terms in GitHub;
                                                      * effective date for new static terms
                                                      2. Info in (i) above will be sent in /search for full catalog for 24 hrs, after this version of static terms is published;
                                                      3. 24 hrs prior to expiry of effective date in (i) above, BNP resends additional info in (i) above;
                                                      4. If BNP wants to change the effective date, they can update the effective date in (i) above and repeat (ii) & (iii) above;
                                                      5. If BNP wants to change their static terms, they need to resubmit their PR with new version no;
                                                      6. It is recommended that the BNP should give at least 15 days of advance notice when they are changing their static terms.
                                                      2. Acceptance by seller NP (SNP)
                                                      1. If SNP accepts the static terms in /search above, they need to send accept="Y" in /on_search;
                                                      2. If SNP doesn’t accept the static terms in /search above, they need to send accept="N" in /on_search;
                                                      3. If SNP doesn’t accept the static terms for a BNP, they should stop responding with their catalog for the corresponding BNP from the effective date;
                                                      4. If SNP doesn’t accept the static terms but continues to send their catalog, BNP may, at their discretion, choose to delist the sellers for this SNP;
                                                      5. Static terms agreed to between the BNP & SNP will be a part of /confirm and /confirm;
________________
Transaction flows
Buyer NP (BNP) integration with logistics
                                                      1. Integration between retail buyer NP (BNP) & LSP will have similar flow as for retail seller NP;
                                                      2. Since logistics is a separate domain, BNP needs to register as buyer NP for the logistics domain (LBNP);
                                                      3. Retail seller NP (SNP) that supports fulfillment by BNP will also enable the fulfillment type "Buyer-Delivery";
                                                      4. Integration steps are defined for pre-order flow (i.e. up to creation of logistics order) and post-order flow (i.e. status & other update, cancellation, tracking), with additions to retail contract highlighted;
                                                      5. Pre-order flow
                                                      1. LSP catalog
                                                      1. connected: on-network call for LSP catalog:
                                                      * LBNP sends /search thru gateway & gateway broadcasts to LSPs:
                                                      * Logistics /search requires start & end gps coordinates & city code, weight / dimensions of package being shipped, etc.;
                                                      * Logistics /search[1134] should be sequenced after receiving response for retail /select;
                                                      * LSP(s) send logistics catalog directly to LBNP;
                                                      2. disconnected:
                                                      * BNP maintains rate card for logistics (includes rate, TAT for distance slabs); 
                                                      2. If SNP supports "Buyer-Delivery" fulfillment type, /on_select should have for the corresponding fulfillment:
                                                      1. quote with packaging charges / convenience fee, as applicable (delivery charge of 0);
                                                      2. O2S TAT;
                                                      3. weight & dimensions of package;
                                                      3. SNP can also include their own fulfillment types (for delivery, self-pickup):
                                                      1. BNP consolidates fulfillment options from LSP & SNP for buyer;
                                                      2. for fulfillment options from LSP, BNP will need to compute O2D as O2S + S2D (S2D will have 1st mile & last mile components and there may be an overlap between O2S & 1st mile component especially for F&B);
                                                      4. If buyer selects fulfillment corresponding to "Buyer-Delivery" fulfillment type, corresponding fulfillment id should be mapped to item and passed in /init to SNP:
                                                      1. In response, SNP will send the updated quote, for the selected fulfillment, including packaging charges / convenience fee (as applicable) & O2S TAT;
                                                      2. SNP also updates whether RTO action results in actual return to origin;
                                                      5. Order will be confirmed with SNP with the above fulfillment id / quote / TAT as sent by SNP in /on_init:
                                                      6. Logistics order will be confirmed by LBNP with the selected fulfillment id;
                                                      6. Post-order flow
                                                      1. State update:
                                                      1. SNP updates retail order state to "Packed";
                                                      2. SNP notifies "ready_to_ship" for retail order:
                                                      * "ready_to_ship" and "Packed" may be sent in any sequence:
                                                      * at the same time;
                                                      * "ready_to_ship" followed by "Packed";
                                                      * "Packed" followed by "ready_to_ship";
                                                      * SNP also sends pickup code (PCC / authorization) along with "ready_to_ship";
                                                      3. On receiving "ready_to_ship" from SNP, LBNP notifies "ready_to_ship" to LSP, with pickup code:
                                                      * In response, LSP updates pickup slot & shipping label (for hub-based delivery);
                                                      * BNP forwards pickup slot & shipping label (for hub-based delivery) to SNP using /update;
                                                      4. When agent is assigned ("Agent-assigned"), LSP sends agent details to LBNP using /on_status:
                                                      * BNP forwards this status to SNP using /update:
                                                      * SNP will need to handle cases where fulfillment states are received out of sequence, e.g. "Agent-assigned" before "Packed";
                                                      5. After fulfillment is picked up, LSP updates status of logistics order to "Order-picked-up", with pickup time:
                                                      * BNP requests update of retail order / fulfillment state & pickup time using /update;
                                                      6. After fulfillment is delivered, LSP updates state of logistics order to "Order-delivered":
                                                      * BNP requests update of retail order / fulfillment state & delivery time using /update;
                                                      * After all fulfillments are marked "Order-delivered", SNP should update order state to "Completed";
                                                      7. All interim states between iv & vi will also be updated in same way;
                                                      8. In case of off-network logistics, all state updates need to be provided by BNP in same way;
                                                      2. Cancellation:
                                                      1. LSP cancels:
                                                      * LSP cancels logistics order using /on_cancel, with reason code and their subscriber id in "cancelled_by";
                                                      * BNP cancels the retail order / fulfillment (passing the same cancellation reason from LSP);
                                                      * If RTO initiated:
                                                      * BNP requests state update, for forward & reverse fulfillment, for retail order (see "State update" above);
                                                      * SNP may cancel order either at "RTO_Initiated" or terminal state ("RTO_Delivered", "RTO_Disposed");
                                                      * Cancellation charges (including RTO costs as applicable) will be communicated by BNP to SNP, if SNP is liable for such charges:
                                                      * state update & cancellation charges will be communicated to SNP using /update;
                                                      * cancellation charges will not be included in the order quote and separate keys will be provided for this (as these are receivables due from SNP to BNP);
                                                      2. Buyer / BNP cancels:
                                                      * BNP cancels retail order / fulfillment using /cancel;
                                                      * BNP cancels logistics order using /cancel;
                                                      * If RTO initiated:
                                                      * BNP requests state update, for forward & reverse fulfillment, for retail order (see "State updates" above);
                                                      * SNP to cancel order either at RTO initiation or terminal state;
                                                      * Cancellation charges including RTO costs (as applicable) will be communicated by BNP to SNP, if SNP is liable for such charges:
                                                      * state update & cancellation charges will be communicated to SNP using /update;
                                                      * cancellation charges will not be included in the order quote and separate keys will be provided for this (as these are receivables due from SNP to BNP);
                                                      3. SNP cancels:
                                                      * SNP cancels retail order / fulfillment using /on_cancel;
                                                      * BNP cancels logistics order (passing same cancellation reason from SNP) using /cancel;
                                                      * If RTO initiated:
                                                      * BNP request state update, for forward & reverse fulfillment, for retail order (see "Status updates" above);
                                                      * SNP to cancel order either at RTO initiation or terminal state;
                                                      * Cancellation charges including RTO costs (as applicable) will be communicated by BNP to SNP, if SNP is liable for such charges:
                                                      * state update & cancellation charges will be communicated to SNP using /update;
                                                      * cancellation charges will not be included in the order quote and separate keys will be provided for this (as these are receivables due from SNP to BNP);
                                                      4. For off-network logistics, all state updates for forward / reverse fulfillment need to be provided by BNP;
                                                      3. Return:
                                                      1. Charges:
                                                      * SNP handles return pickup => no additional charges to be sent in order quote;
                                                      * SNP doesn’t handle return pickup => BNP will need to factor in return costs;
                                                      2. Flow:
                                                      * SNP handles return pickup => existing flow applies;
                                                      * SNP doesn’t handle return pickup:
                                                      * BNP sends return request;
                                                      * SNP approves return request with status "Return_Approved" and also sends reverse qc details for return pickup check;
                                                      * BNP creates & places order for logistics for return pickup;
                                                      * BNP requests state update, for return fulfillment (see "Status update" above);
                                                      4. Tracking:
                                                      1. Tracking of order / fulfillment will be directly between BNP & LSP:
                                                      * SNP tracking - may be enabled later;
                                                      5. Other updates:
                                                      1. In case of part-cancel of items, BNP may update logistics order with updated weight / dimensions / order value;
                                                      2. Weight differential
                                                      * LSP sends updated quote / weight / dimension due to weight differential to LBNP:
                                                      * LBNP forwards weight / dimension / receivables due from SNP, due to weight differential, to SNP;
                                                      * SNP to inform BNP if they accept or dispute the weight differential updates:
                                                      * If SNP disputes:
                                                      * LBNP communicates to LSP that weight differential updates are rejected;
                                                      * LSP handles order delivery as per static terms;
                                                      * resolution of dispute will follow IGM route (details tbd);
                                                      * If SNP accepts:
                                                      * differential cost will not be included in order quote and separate keys will be provided for this (as these are receivables due from SNP to BNP);
                                                      7. Summary of additions to retail contract
                                                      1. /on_search:
                                                      1. additional fulfillment option for provider for "Buyer-Delivery";
                                                      2. /on_select:
                                                      1. quote with packaging charges / misc for fulfillment option "Buyer-Delivery";
                                                      2. O2S TAT for fulfillment option "Buyer-Delivery";
                                                      3. weight & dimensions of package for fulfillment option "Buyer-Delivery";
                                                      3. /on_init:
                                                      1. whether (items in) fulfillment should be returned in case of RTO;
                                                      2. updated fulfillment TAT for O2S;
                                                      4. /confirm:
                                                      1. Confirmed retail order details will also include weight & dim for order, O2S TAT;
                                                      5. /update:
                                                      1. Order / fulfillment state updates;
                                                      2. Communication of receivables due from SNP to BNP;
________________
Seller NP (SNP) collecting payment
                                                         1. SNP that wants to collect payment should set "bpp_terms"."collect_payment" to "Y" in /on_search (full catalog refresh);
                                                         2. Buyer NP (BNP) that wants to place order with this SNP will need to render the payment link sent by SNP:
                                                         1. SNP sends following additional attributes in /on_init for rendering payment link:
                                                         1. payment.type="ON-ORDER" (prepaid);
                                                         2. payment.collected_by="BPP";
                                                         3. payment.uri="secure_public_pg_link";
                                                         4. payment.status="NOT-PAID";
                                                         2. BNP will need to render this payment link for the buyer, after receiving the /on_init response;
                                                         3. SNP updates payment collection details using unsolicited /on_init:
                                                         1. Scenario 1 - collection successful, payment status updated:
                                                         1. payment.params:currency, amount (order value), transaction_id (unique transaction reference);
                                                         2. payment.status="PAID";
                                                         3. payment.tags.bpp_collect.success="Y";
                                                         4. in this case, BNP should proceed with /confirm;
                                                         2. Scenario 2 - collection successful, payment status not updated:
                                                         1. payment.params:currency, amount (order value), transaction_id (if available);
                                                         2. payment.status="NOT-PAID";
                                                         3. payment.tags.bpp_collect.success="Y";
                                                         4. in this case, BNP may terminate the transaction or proceed with /confirm. If BNP proceeds with /confirm, SNP should honour /confirm as per the contract and it will be the SNP’s responsibility to subsequently update payment.status when available;
                                                         3. Scenario 3 - collection error:
                                                         1. payment.params:currency, amount (order value);
                                                         2. payment.status="NOT-PAID";
                                                         3. payment.tags.bpp_collect.success="N";
                                                         4. payment.tags.bpp_collect.error="error_message";
                                                         5. in this case, BNP should terminate the transaction;
                                                         4. If BNP doesn’t receive payment collection details (as per 3 above) within its TAT:
                                                         1. BNP should terminate the transaction and if the payment collection details are subsequently received, it should NACK /on_init with error code 20009;
                                                         2. BNP may also send another /init request for the latest payment collection details and follow (a) above if the /on_init callback doesn’t have the required payment collection details;
________________


Force cancellation
                                                         1. Considering that /cancel is a request by buyer NP (BNP) for seller NP (SNP) to cancel order / fulfillment, there may be a need for BNP to initiate "force cancellation" for certain cases like buyer requesting cancellation due to fulfillment TAT breach;
                                                         2. All orders / fulfillment(s) can be cancelled at any stage before delivery;
                                                         3. Cancellation terms can be defined by SNP:
                                                         1. includes cancellation fee as flat amount / % (% to be interpreted as follows):
                                                         1. % of order value (excluding taxes) for order cancellation;
                                                         2. % of fulfillment value (i.e. item + fulfillment level costs excluding taxes) for fulfillment cancellation (in case of multiple fulfillments);
                                                         3. for order with multiple fulfillments, cancellation fees may be defined as %;
                                                         2. can be optionally defined at:
                                                         1. order level (in /on_init);
                                                         3. will be applicable, for cancellation of order / fulfillment, only after corresponding order state is "Accepted";
                                                         4. Cancellation terms definition:
                                                         1. /on_init - cancellation fee for specific fulfillment state & reason code, with option for wildcard ("*") as the catch-all clause covering combination of fulfillment state & reason code not specifically defined;
                                                         5. Cancellation fee calculation:
                                                         1. for /on_cancel response:
                                                         1. (order value - updated order value in /on_cancel)
                                                         2. for no /on_cancel response:
                                                         1. if matching the specific fulfillment state & reason code, the cancellation fee will be as defined in cancellation terms for /on_init;
                                                         2. if not matching, cancellation fee will be 0;
                                                         6. Cancellation:
                                                         1. BNP initiates cancellation for order / fulfillment using /cancel (with reason code / fulfilment id, as applicable);
                                                         2. Includes TAT for receiving valid cancellation response;
                                                         3. If SNP sends valid /on_cancel response within TAT:
                                                         1. response has updated quote, order / fulfillment state set to cancelled;
                                                         2. BNP processes response and calculates cancellation fee as defined above;
                                                         4. If SNP doesn’t send valid response / doesn’t respond within TAT:
                                                         1. BNP sends force cancel request for order / fulfillment, i.e. /cancel request with "force" = "yes";
                                                         2. If SNP sends valid response within TAT, processing will be as defined in c above;
                                                         3. If SNP doesn’t send (valid) response:
                                                         * BNP will create IGM issue for resolution (after expiry of TAT), including details such as cancellation fee calculated, refund issued (as applicable);
                                                         * resolution of IGM issue will create a valid /on_cancel response for the "force" cancellation;
________________
Authorization (OTP)
Authorization enables seller NP (SNP) to authorize pickup and logistics buyer NP (LBNP) to authorize delivery of an order on verification of specific auth code (e.g. OTP), generated for this purpose;
Proposed flow for authorization is:
                                                            1. SNP requests for LSP that supports authorization for pickup:
                                                            1. If SNP is not LBNP, this request will be routed through LBNP;
                                                            2. LBNP requests for LSP that supports authorization for delivery:
                                                            1. 1 & 2 will be in the same /search request;
                                                            2. Only LSPs that support authorization requested should respond with their catalog;
                                                            3. SNP creates auth code for pickup, with validity, and sends to LSP, typically after the order is packed:
                                                            1. If SNP is not LBNP, this request will be routed through LBNP;
                                                            4. LBNP creates auth code for delivery, with validity, and sends to BNP, typically when the order is out for delivery:
                                                            1. If SNP is LBNP, this will be sent using /on_status;
                                                            5. After the order is picked up, LSP sends /on_status with fulfillment state "Order-picked-up" and with the pickup auth code:
                                                            1. If BNP is LBNP, this request will be routed to SNP using /update;
                                                            2. SNP verifies the pickup auth code and if not valid:
                                                            1. NACKs request with error code 40010 (expired auth code) or 40011 (invalid auth code) which needs to be mapped by LBNP to error codes 62510 & 62511 respectively;
                                                            2. In case of expired auth code, seller NP subsequently regenerates auth code for pickup and sends to LSP thru LBNP;
                                                            6. After the order is delivered, LSP sends /on_status with fulfillment state "Order-delivered" and with delivery auth code:
                                                            1. LBNP verifies the delivery auth code and NACKs /on_status with error code 62510 (expired auth code) or 62511 (invalid auth code);
                                                            2. In case of expired auth code (error code 62510), LBNP regenerates auth code for delivery and sends to BNP:
                                                            1. If SNP is LBNP, this will be sent using /on_status;

[1032] (optional) reference to issue related to cancel request raised in IGM, this will be added here only after issue resolution and returned in all post-order APIs like /on_status, /on_update, /on_cancel;
[1033] pre-cancel state of fulfillment, i.e. state of fulfillment prior to cancellation;
[1034] updated order value including cancellation charges (delivery + packing charges);
[1035] tax on fulfillment level charges, to be included only if not 0 (i.e. logistics buyer NP provides tax inclusive fulfillment level charges);
[1036] for single fulfillment order, terminal state will be "Cancelled" (if RTO is initiated); for multi-fulfillment order, terminal state will depend on the status of the other fulfillment(s);
[1037] items reassigned from forward fulfillment to RTO fulfillment;
[1038] forward fulfillment is cancelled and RTO reasons added;

contact no - 10 digits;
merchant order no - max 6 alphanumeric;
other pickup confirmation code - max 6 alphanumeric;
OTP - max 6 alphanumeric;

[m]@supriyo@ondc.org - which one should we consider? - the buyer finder fee coming in incremental catalog refresh or the one being sent in full catalog refresh request? In full catalog refresh there's ability to send different buyer finder fee rates per category so SNPs may get category wise rates. This is not the case in incremental.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[n]both send BFF by category (RET code); where's the issue?
[o]In full catalog refresh (search by city), there's this optional property  


"category":
{
"id":"Foodgrains"
},


through which BNPs can specify category wise BFFs under a RET code. This option is not there in incremental refresh request.
[p]In full catalog refresh (search by city), there's this optional property 


"category":
{
"id":"Foodgrains"
},


through which BNPs can specify category wise BFFs under a RET code. This option is not there in incremental refresh request.

[am]@supriyo@ondc.org In on_select response there is an example of FREEDELIVERY type offer. It's a discount type offer and in the definition template there is no example of such offer type and it closely matches with flat offer types based on cart value. This Free delivery type offers should be sent in on_search as well ?? And if it is it's body should match with which kind of offers?? Since there is item_ids field also present. So should we keep it is as empty or should we not include it ??, because it's impractical to send thousands of item id's for free delivery type of offer.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[an]1. offer definition in /on_search is to enable buyer apps to publish these offers for the seller;
2. offer applicability criteria for publishing (item_ids, location_ids, category_ids, validity dates) is optional as shown in the /on_search sample payload;
3. offer application in order quote (/on_select & forward APIs) is when the offer actually gets applied;
4. note that offer publishing & offer application are independent and it's not necessary to publish all offers;
will add the template for this offer thru addendum, to be released shortly;

bpp/fulfillments - at NP level;
id & type should be same, above has contact info as well;

[av]@supriyo@ondc.org - I am from Paytm buyer app, and we're planning to consume item availability timings. Few questions:
1. Can customisations also have timings?
2. If yes, then what if the base item timings and customisation item timings differ from each other? Do we still show the item without the customisation if item timings are open, but customisation timings are close?
3. What if few customisation items are closed because of which the item does not have enough open customisations to show (as per minimum customisations logic): do we not show the base item at all at that time?
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[aw]1. yes;
2. considering that a customization group (and associated customizations) can be assigned to multiple base items, you should only show those customizations whose timing intersect with the base item;
3. either you show the base item as not available (along with availability)
[ax]@supriyo@ondc.org Close_timing need to be considered for all combination of provider/location status: enable,disable,open,close right and not just close?
@ravi.yadav@paytm.com
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[ay]no - this is only to handle the edge case where store details (e.g. serviceability) for a currently closed store is being updated thru full refresh;
in other cases, for a currently closed store, SNP can send store with label as "close", in which case, BNP need not process the store details

[dt]@supriyo@ondc.org


1. Closed polygon - In the second example here, the polygon is a closed polygon(meaning the first and last coordinates are the same). the first one is not. Are buyer apps expected to assume that the first and last coordinates make one of the boundaries if that is not mentioned?
2. Order of the vertices of the polygon - Please confirm if the consecutive vertices together form all the sides of the polygon here.
3. Should the merchant be within the polygon?
4. Limit in the number of polygons in multipolygon


CC: @deepti.aggarwal@paytm.com @athira.warrier@paytm.com @jerin1.john@paytm.com @ravi.yadav@paytm.com @amit.saluja@paytm.com
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[du]@tanya.madaan@ondc.org - pls respond
_Reassigned to _
[dv]Please find below the responses:


1. Closed Polygon - The first and last coordinates of the polygon should match - Recommendation. However, if the first and last coordinates does not match, there are libraries like geopandas, which automatically create polygon by joining first and last coordinates. 


2. Yes, the consecutive coordinates in the array form edges. This is again automatically plotted by available libraries. It is sellers responsibility to define the coordinates in correct sequence.


3. Yes, when a polygon is plotted, the coordinates falling within the polygon are considered serviceable. However, there are polygons with holes as well, which can define the non-serviceable areas within the polygon. 


How it is defined:


{
"type": "MultiPolygon",
"coordinates": [
[
{polygon},
{hole},
{hole},
{hole}
]
]
}


Or distinct Multi-polygon, without holes:


{
"type": "MultiPolygon",
"coordinates": [
[
[
{polygon}
]
],
[
[
{polygon}
]
],
[
[
{polygon}
]
],
]
}


4. There is no limit defined on the number of polygons within a multipolygon construct. Do you see any challenge here.
[dw]@tanya.madaan@ondc.org - could you please with the below queries also - 
What does following keys mean (use-case) in the given polygon data
1. type: use case and possible values (eg: "FeatureCollection")
2. features.type: use case and possible values (eg: "Feature")
3. properties: use case and possible values (currently empty)
4. in features.geometry.type - we can have only polygon and multiPolygon as values, right?
[dx]will sellers always send lat long in correct order, long first and lat second? @supriyo@ondc.org @tanya.madaan@ondc.org
_Assigned to _
[dy]yes, as per the geojson format
[dz]@supriyo@ondc.org -If there is a conflict b/w serviceability timings and store timings i.e. 
1. serviceability timings are subset of store timings, in that case, is it correct to assume, that after the serviceability timing ends, the particular category is not be shown to user. And if the same serviceability timing is applicable for all categories, then the entire store is not to be shown to the user, even if as per store timings, the store should be open. Is the understanding correct? 
2. serviceability timing exceeds store timings, can we assume, that in this case, store timings are to be given precedence over serviceability timings?
3. Also, does the contract support different serviceabilities at different timings, e.g. from day -1 to day -3 and time - 9am to 12pm -> coordinates are different and day - 4 to day - 6, coordinates are different. 
4. Do buyer apps have to do any validations on serviceability value? like for the "properties" key mentioned in the payload, are there any validations to be done like it has to be a valid json etc.
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[ea]1. serviceability timings should be subset of store timings;
2. different serviceability can be defined for different times of day for different days of the week e.g. Domino's has different serviceability for day & night;
3. polygon / multi-polygon should be valid geojson;

[ht]The error code 40002 - "Item Quantity Unavailable" is the closest thing I can find.

[hu]we can support min qty but what's the usecase?
[hv]For certain low value goods and/or goods with small physical size (eg: basic stationary), merchants want to enforce minimum of X units per order. This is mostly to pack orders more efficiently.
They don't want to create separate variants for 'Pack of X' because they would like to support orders with X+1 units, instead of being forced to sell in multiples of X
[hw]ok, will consider adding

[li]This doc that goes over the details of the payment collection and settlement flow - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iqLdayk488ekEzKrEs-yn6gVrevbxBkILBe5j4oIxMY/edit


It explains that the Buyer NP has the right to assert the collection of payment during /search or during /init, and if it doesn't make this assertion, the Seller NP must collect the payment.


Is this flow still valid? How should the Seller NP respond to the /init if is not equipped to accept payments?

[pw]@supriyo@ondc.org 


1] In the buyer app i can see multiple return request can be raised for the same item with different return ids for each request received? Is this expected?


2] If a single return request is raised for more than one items will the return id be different or same?


Please help me understand
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
[px]1. a. If there are multiple qty for an item, you can raise separate return request for diff qty for same item;
b. If a return request is rejected once, you can re-raise the return request (with diff id), within the return window;
2. If there are different items, you should raise separate return request for each item as the return window / merchant authorization duration may be different for each item; only exception is for F&B where items & customizations, that are part of same dynamic item, can be a part of the same return request (with single id);
[py]@supriyo@ondc.org Thanks for the reply. I totally agree with your point.

So as you mentioned separate return request for different quantity and re-raising the return request  if its rejected with different return ids are perfect. 


Actually what I am facing in the buyer application is - 


Different return id generated for the same item with exact same qty of the previous return request even though no rejection response sent from our side. 


Please help me with understanding this concept
[pz]item I1 with 2 qty: I can send 2 return requests (with separate ids) for i1, qty 1;
each of these requests will have separate merchant authorization;
is this what's happening?

this goes on an on i can keep on raising multiple return requests for the same item with the whole quantity and each time the return id we receive is different.
[qb]considering that these are stateless APIs, buyer app will send the return requests with distinct ids to seller but seller will only accept one & reject the others

1. fulfillment.tags.quote_details will be empty

• 3] discount to be included only if not 0; (condition not present in v1.2.0 Phase 2 doc.  Assuming can be included even if its zero.)
• 4] misc to be included only if not 0;
• 5] delivery charge to be included only if fulfillment state code is "Serviceable";  (ie include if its zero as well)
6] current: Phase 2 doc: tax on fulfillment level charges, to be included only if not 0 (i.e. logistics buyer NP provides tax inclusive fulfillment level charges);
_Assigned to supriyo@ondc.org_
